author: {'steamid': '76561198068370015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 70133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18408, 'playtime_at_review': 61059, 'last_played': 1712352504}
review:
The best long-term idler I've played thus far, and lord knows I've been through a lot of them. Its been around for years and has tons of content and challenges to get through. There's a pretty complete wiki, which you'll need.

A particularly nice feature of the game is that both quick and slow resets are actually useful at any given time. There is always progress being made.

One negative I can see is that it will take you a very very long time IRL to unlock a lot of this content. This is only a negative if you're looking for an idle game that has an end / finish to it. If you're looking for something that perpetually has more and more things for you to do

Another negative is that with so much content you'll get confused even with the reasonably complete wiki. Certain helpful things that can speed you up a lot may get missed. In my case, it took me a long time to realize just how powerful training your pets could be. Im sure there are other inefficiencies I'm overlooking as well. But thankfully you can have a good time with this game even blundering about like I am.

Actually there is one more negative that I almost forgot. Because of the long term time scale this game works at, some of the challenges are.... rough. Specifically I mean your first Ultimate Baal Challenge. Its recommended as one of the first challenges you can do and its quite unforgiving. Resets everything back to start and you have to fight through the gods again. Wiki says it'll take a week, it took me two. It's way beyond what you might be expecting from a "prestige" reset. Is it worth it? Yes, Crystal Factory will quickly become absurdly powerful. Do I wish the game and/or wiki was more explicit in saying "prepare your anus"? Yes. The only reason I stuck with it is because I had other negative reviews complaining about it so I was expecting it.

Overall this is the best idler I've played, for the sort of idler I'm interested in. Long term, happily hands off, with lots of content and complicated systems. Just remember that JFC the UBC is a PITA, SMH.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044557266', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 261485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261467, 'last_played': 1710881108}
review:
Disclaimer: I played this a lot +5 years ago, it was a different game, tried to pick up again, but ended remembered why I droped it in a single day

The most important thing to understand is that this game was pratically finished a long ago, but it got extended with new mechanics over the time once the dev noticed that launching new games is a risky endeavour (see their next game: cooking game)

If you only play the original, now called the early game - about P.Baal and some challange runs -  where focus is more on your character itself getting stronger and learning god powers - then you will be for a really fun and imaginative idler.

But latter content diverts from the theme and power scale... you get pets (and waifus)  that train, get classes, go in dungeons, and build a city; you get a planetary factory that need to be defended by your clones and not yourself; those doesn't make sense when you are a god creating stars and finger flicking entire phanteons.

Also a lot of those latter mechanics exacerbate the game's main flaw - and probably the reason people say this games requires too much active play - rebirth requires too much agenda and forward planning. Let me describe some things that you need to consider:

- from a normal rebirth to a somewhat decent pace is not a fast process because you need to recreate and alocate your shadow clones (can be some minutes to some hours depending on how you spent your gp)
- not all mechanics/clone assigment unlock instally depending on your power at the moment, you may need to wait to build the div. generator for example
- if you get pets in dungeons or campains, its best to wait these to finish (and remember to pick the rewards!) before even rebirthing - and those can be really major problems as you need to set beforehand their duration (as know as guess when you will come back) in hours, up to 12. You can easly be blocked from rebirthing for hours.
- you may soon have to defend your factory from some ultimate beings - this gives a good reward... wait some extra minutes
- you may also need to wait your pets to be at the right hunger threshold so they grow stronger faster

This shows that game's definition of hardcore is less in form of complex mechanics interacting withother and finding the optimal investiment; and more in from of timing your activities so you get the best rewards.

This all makes for idler that you don't play when you get a opportunity, but a game that gives you opportunities to play it from time to time... and this is not what most people expect from a idler...

author: {'steamid': '76561198124692789', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 235, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1619985754}
review:
[h1] Idling to Rule the Gods [/h1] 
Idling to Rule the Gods offers a casual and incremental gaming experience centered around deity simulation. While its idle gameplay mechanics and progression systems may appeal to fans of the genre seeking a relaxing and long-term gaming experience, others may find its slow pace and reliance on waiting to be less engaging. Overall, the game provides a neutral experience that may entertain players looking for a low-effort and long-term idle game, but may not offer enough depth or variety to hold the interest of all players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025188831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 355529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8067, 'playtime_at_review': 327890, 'last_played': 1712455344}
review: One of the best idle games out there. Up there with Realm Grinder and Cookie Clicker, but with more mechanics, and honestly more engaging than either of them ever were. Rebirths need to be short to be effective, so it can be a bit fast paced (for an idle game) but it's both a creative and (relatively) exiting take on my favorite genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045480611', 'num_games_owned': 757, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 68409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19004, 'playtime_at_review': 6320, 'last_played': 1712455112}
review:
I cannot recommend this game. The UI is extremely convoluted, there's grammatical errors all over the place, and the game systems / features are not explained very well. Toss in the dev's responses to some of the other reviews (like shinami's), and you have the makings of a very bad "idle" game which is anything but idle.

It should not be considered "the right strategy" to look things up and spoil the game for yourself.

And there's bugs galore. Sometimes the game ignores numbers you put in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198305774188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 69976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7926, 'playtime_at_review': 55127, 'last_played': 1712407102}
review:
Awesome game. The developer is active on discord and regularly posts updates and is helpful. I also love that the community can submit art and the developers places it in game(so far I've seen pet art being incorporated. not sure about other stuff)

For a free to play game, its not heavily monetized, sure there are in-game purchases but the game doesn't force them onto you. Some premium features that are very helpful to players can be earned via in game items, it takes time but this is an idle game so time really isn't an issue. No forced ads, you can watch ads and they offer it in the best way possible, watch ads to get points and you can use the points to get certain stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993954225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 227851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18867, 'playtime_at_review': 87808, 'last_played': 1712454588}
review:
This game is absolutely addicting as hell. If you can get past the several week "tutorial", you're be sucked into a game that will suck many years out of your life. It is the best 'idle' game that I have ever played. It's active when you want to be active, and idle when real life needs your attention. It's as complicated or as simple as you want. Perfect for every kind of player.

100% recommend.

review:
Bestest spiel ever! wirklich! ich spiel das seit über 3 Jahren durchgehend jeden tag also.....das muss schon was heissen!

ist halt komplett frei von werbung und kommt ohne zwangspurchases aus!

- Spiel das spiel genau so wie du willst, du hast 1000 oder wahrscheinlich noch viel mehr möglichkeiten ans ziel zu kommen.
- kein online zwang und auch keine wirkliche competition zu anderen spielern ausser dem austausch deiner stats.
- Massive updates fast wöchentlich, Events & PETS, PETS , PETS! Dungeons, Kampagnen, Quests, götter besiegen.....alter was willst du noch mehr? Ach ja, schon vergessen zu erwähnen, dass es völlig kostenlos ist?  auf android, Windows, apple und kongregate?

author: {'steamid': '76561199193525994', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 45755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 937, 'playtime_at_review': 25708, 'last_played': 1712443384}
review:
ITRTG is a nice game with idle mechanic focus, the experiences as well as improvements added to the game over time don't let you feel stagnation and with a wide range of challenges that change how you can play, it is truly something that won't bore you.
I want to mention that some reviews that state that it is insane for a 'tutorial' to take about a week don't have a perspective of a person that is deeper in the game and now can truly feel satisfaction with the fact that in the same environment you can do it in a day(Ultimate Baal challenge). 
One of the main long term attractions for me in this game is the feeling of progress and at the same time challenge in what I do and this game always gave me that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055448351', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 317320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19491, 'playtime_at_review': 139979, 'last_played': 1712455248}
review:
THE Idle Game to end all idle games. Has a surprising amount of depth to it and an insane amount of collectibles, unlockable QoL upgrades, and in-game achievements for an idle game. And of course, ridiculously huge numbers :)
Did you know Trigintillion is a number?
It's a 1 followed by 93 zeroes :D


It also excels at the No.1 thing that a good idle game should do: It uses practically zero resources on your computer to run, and never crashes, freezes, or leaks memory. 

You can run this game 24/7/365 and it will have zero impact on any of your other Steam games. Hell, I can even play STARFIELD with this ITRTG running in the background, and it has zero negative impact on how it runs. 

And don't forget, it's free to play! There's literally no reason NOT to play this game. Just turn it on and let it run.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032541747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 156641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 156641, 'last_played': 1680338594}
review:
このプレイ時間を見てどう思いますか？
他ゲーなら時間泥棒！みたいなレビューになりがちですが、実はまだ序盤でコンテンツ全然消化できていません。
終わる気配がありません。感覚的に１万時間はプレイしないと終盤のコンテンツに手が届かないと思います。
つまりこれは神ゲーです。

・補足です
公開からもう５年以上経ちますがアプデや報酬が美味しいイベントが続いているので、古いゲームだと敬遠せずにプレイしてみる事をおすすめします。
色々この手のゲームは出ていますが、プレイの手軽さと奥深さは断トツだと思います。

author: {'steamid': '76561197972085763', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1694981867}
review:
There's obviously a lot of content here, but the graphics are ugly, derivative weeb assets, and the interface is a monochrome unintuitive mess. It's a drab chore to play, constantly assaulting the player with way too many options that initially do nothing, walls of verbose, badly-formatted and oddly-phrased text, and buttons, stats and prompts that have no clear effect.

Especially the pets section is an infuriatingly convoluted mess. The mini games look like they were done in MS Paint each by a different teenager making their first game. No one who's worked on this game seems to have an inkling of what decent UX is, it's all just piles of disorganized and disjointed data.

If you like janky, obtuse and labyrinthine UIs, don't mind downright atrocious visuals, have the patience of a saint and a penchant for masochism, then this is for you. But this is not a well-designed idle/incremental game compared to what else is out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970943885', 'num_games_owned': 36, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1694706334}

author: {'steamid': '76561198120279764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 147306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5855, 'playtime_at_review': 60660, 'last_played': 1712440594}
review:
Probably the best idle game I've ever played. Even has an idle game within the idle game.
The Challenges keep the gameplay loop of "watch numbers grow larger" really fresh and entertaining, as each  challenge makes you more powerful.

Only minus is that the game will throw a lot of information at you, once you unlock a new mechanic.
It is kinda hard to explain, so if you're curious download the game, defeat the first god and see for yourself if what you've just unlocked is a bit overwhelming.
If you do, don't worry, just focus on the main mechanics introduced to you at the beginning and get used to the new mechanics slowly.
It is a very, very long idling game, not using a new mechanic propperly for a couple of days, or even weeks, means basically nothing in the great scheme of things.
I've played through 1.000 hours of this game and have unlocked maybe half of the mechanics this game has to offer. And I'll probably have to play for 10x that amount to play through all of the content this game has to offer.
So, yeah. Take you're time, it's an idler after all.

In terms of P2W.
There is a shop and you can pay for progress, if you want to.
I'll give this one a pass, since not buying from the shop doesn't take away from your gameplay experience, imo. And I honestly couldn't care less, if someone actually decides to spend their money for progressing in a single player idle game.

Only thing I bought there was "improved next at". Not because I really had to (could have gotten it for free after playing for a little longer), but because it's a little tradition of mine. Whenever I enjoy a F2P game, I buy one or two things from the shop to show my appreciation towards the developer.

In case the developer reads this comment. Thanks a bunch for your efforts.
Also, really looking forward to the next chapters in the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036760290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 327722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10248, 'playtime_at_review': 152600, 'last_played': 1712454740}
review:
The best idle game for me.
Complicated at the beginning, but it gets easier to understand. A lot of different mechanics, but a lot of available information and guides (wiki, discord guides, special spreadsheets, tooltips in-game)
Very polite and helpful community (discord)
Attractive if you like when your numbers go up and you are not afraid of basic math.
Double attractive if you like "pet game" as well.
Game doesnt require whaling or even dolphing, f2p can progress through pretty fast and without issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252047232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 32071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30779, 'last_played': 1703630599}

author: {'steamid': '76561199074398417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1692642435}
review:
The game is really good. The (still positive) reviews saying that you will need to pay attention more in this compared to other idle games, while is true, a lot of these are from a long time ago. The game is still updating to this day, and has made the game less confusing, and has made some features of the game a bit easier to understand on how to progress. The game still keeps what it is original for though, and its still a much more advanced and complicated idle game. But its not complicated to the point you cant still afk play the game, or wont be able to understand it. The beginning may be a bit confusing but you can catch on rather quickly if you read the in game tutorials. So far this game is extremely fun.,

I can tell this game has ALOT of content, and its STILL having updates. If you want a fun idle game, with a story, and with tons of content and updates , then you have it.

review:
Apple pie recipe

Ingredients needed: 
pie crust
apples
granulated sugar
brown sugar
flour
cinnamon
nutmeg
lemon
egg
EQUIPMENT NEEDED FOR MAKING PIE
(Amazon affiliate links) - Check out my favorite kitchen essentials.

9" pie plate 
rolling pin
parchment paper
whisk
spatula
pie weights or dried beans
pie shield or foil
mixing bowls
measuring cups and spoons
When it comes to the perfect apple pie there are 2 questions you need to ask. What kind of apples are best for apple pie and how to get an amazing, flaky pie crust.

BEST APPLES FOR PIE
There are so many apple varieties to choose from when making apple pie. Here a few common varieties that you can find at your local grocery store!

Granny Smith - These are the best apples for making apple pie because they are super tart and very firm. Firm apples hold up well during the baking process unlike varieties such as McIntosh which kind of turn to mush.
Honeycrisp - This is my second choice when it comes to apple pie. This variety is super crisp, tart, sweet and holds up great during the baking process.
Jazz - Another crisp and sweet apple variety.
Golden Delicious - Widely available apple variety. Holds up well during the baking process but will be a little softer than the others.
Jonagold - A little tart and sweet.
Pink Lady - Just like Jonagolds, this variety has a good balance of tart and sweet.
THE PERFECT PIE CRUST

A great apple pie starts with an amazing pie crust. We love to use either this all-butter pie crust or our sourdough pie crust. Each of these pie crust use butter and just a little bit of vinegar to produce a tender, flaky pie crust that just can't be beat!

The crust can be made a few days in advance and kept in the fridge or frozen until ready to assemble your apple pie.

If you decide to use a store-bought crust, make sure to follow the directions on the packaging to determine when to take the crust out of the fridge in order to handle it more easily.

HOW TO MAKE APPLE PIE FROM SCRATCH
Peel, core and slice the apples. In a large mixing bowl, gently toss the apple slices, granulated sugar, light brown sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, lemon zest and lemon juice until well combined and set aside. Place the oven rack in the center position and preheat your oven to 400°F.

Remove the discs of pie crust from the fridge and let set at room temperature for 5-10 minutes. On a lightly floured surface, roll one of the discs into a 12" circle that is ⅛" thick. Place the crust into the bottom of the deep dish pie plate.

A pie crust being placed into a pie dish.
Spoon the apple pie filling into the crust, discarding any liquid at the bottom of the mixing bowl. Spread the apple slices evenly.

Apple slices in the bottom of the pie crust.
On a lightly floured surface, roll the second disc of pie dough into a 12" circle that is ⅛" thick. Place the crust over the apple pie filling.

Use a sharp knife to trim the excess dough from around the edge of the pie plate. Use your fingers to pull both the bottom and top pie crust up and slightly away from the edge of the pie dish. Fold the edge under itself and press down to seal the edge in place. Rotate the pie a quarter turn and repeat until edges are neatly tucked in.


Place the pie dish onto a baking sheet and gently brush the surface of the dough with the egg wash and sprinkle sanding sugar on top. Use a sharp knife to cut vents in the crust.


In order to protect the edges of the pie from over-browning, use a long strip of aluminum foil (about 38" long) by folding it in half lengthwise and then folding in half again, lengthwise. Wrap it around the edges of the pie plate and over the edges of the crust. This is referred to as a "pie shield".


A strip of foil around the edges of the pie keeps them from over-browning while baking.
Bake the pie at 400°F for 25 minutes. Remove the pie shield, lower the oven temperature to 375°F and bake an additional 30-35 minutes.

You'll know the apple pie is done when the crust is a lovely golden brown and the juice is bubbling up the sides of the pan.

TIP: I recommend using a pie shield during the first 25 minutes of baking instead the second half of baking to prevent burning yourself when placing the shield onto the pie dish.


HOW TO STORE
The pie can be made up to 2 days ahead of time and stored, loosely covered, at room temperature or covered in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999166071', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1688846333}
review:
I launched it once.  But after realising how complex it seemed, I decided I would start it again when I had more time.  BIG mistake!  No way to reset game and start over.  No basic instructions (maybe because I closed the game the first time, IDK).  I have no idea what's going on here.  It said I have a billion shadow clones from the game I couldn't reset, but won't tell me what they're for.  This is stupid.

Edit in response to Dev:  Maybe I embellished the exact number a bit.  My apologies. 
 But the number was quite high in "multiple digit land".  My review was out of frustration.  I have no doubt that it must be something good for all the positive reviews.  But I didn't get that first impression with your game.

I basically remember when I first launched it, I felt strongly overwhelmed with all that was going on, without me even triggering anything from the start.  (It was counting up so fast, I was like "WTH, what am I supposed to do now?"  So I closed it right away and decided to come back to it when I could.  But that wasn't for a month or so.

So I relaunched it, and it showed Shadow Clones WAY up there.  I tried to give it a second shot at trying to figure things out, but there didn't seem to be any guidance.  (I assumed that maybe I killed whatever tutorial there was by shutting the game down prematurely the first time.)  I also tried to find settings to try over again from the beginning, but couldn't find anything.

Maybe if there was some kind of backstory, or explanation as to what-does-what, I would've spent more time with it.  But there didn't seem to be any of that.  So I gave up again and uninstalled it.

I would definitely give it a 3rd try if there was something to make it less confusing, and tell me what I looking at.
developer_response:
Having 1 billion shadow clones without playing for years is kinda impossible to get.
Maybe you are confusing it with something else. You can easily reset your game if you either delete it on your pc and then start it without sync online or go to the settings and select reset game.

The tooltips and many info pages and the FAQ pages ingame explain a lot of stuff if you read a bit. The game also has a Wiki with lots of in-depht info: https://itrtg.wiki.gg/wiki/Main_Page

review: They say it takes 10,000 hours of practice to master a new skill. At more than 16,000 hours in to this game, I'm still only just entering late mid-game and I feel most of the time that I barely understand this game. ItRtG is not a game for the feint of heart. It's an idle game where some days you can idle, but other days it can consume your attention. If you love numbers and enjoy a good challenge, then this game is for you.

review: With absolutely zero graphics and no animation, all numbers and text, this is the best idle game there is and I've played plenty. It's complex, rich, diverse and it takes absolutely forever to complete (all achievements), but that is actually the best part of it - you don't get bored with it for years to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198871285566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1683523355}
review:
cute, fun idle game! love the art style lots!!!! i haven't really seen too many idle games where you can customize your character quite like you can on this game!!! (i am newer to idle games, so if you can have any more idle games with customization characters comment them so i can check them out!!!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198415891744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 796, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1682933948}
review:
Все равно никто не читает мои отзывы.
Кину рецепт Квас из цикория в домашних условиях


Продукты
Вода 3л
Сахар 200 гр.
Цикорий 1 стол. л.
Сухие дрожжи 1 чайн. л.
Лимонная Кислота 0.5 чайн. л.


В глубокую кастрюлю всыпьте цикорий, сахар и лимонную кислоту влейте воду и перемешайте.
Поставьте кастрюлю на средний огонь и доведите смесь до кипения.
Как только раствор закипит, уберите кастрюлю с огня и охладите при комнатной температуре до 37-40°С. Проверить температуру при отсутствии специального термометра можно следующим образом: капните жидкость на запястье. Если капля чуть теплая, значит смесь охладилась до нужной температуры.
Когда вода остынет, рассыпьте сухие дрожжи по поверхности. Когда дрожжи напитаются влагой, перемешайте. Дрожжи перед применением лучше проверить. Небольшое количество дрожжей нужно залить чуть теплой подслащенной водой (37-40°С) и оставить на 10-15 минут. Должна появиться пенная шапочка. Это значит, что дрожжи живые, не просроченные. Если шапочки нет, то такие дрожжи не стоит использовать. Квас не получится.
Кастрюлю накройте марлей или прикройте крышкой и оставьте квас при комнатной температуре на 6 часов.
По истечении 6 часов на поверхности появится пенка. Это значит, что дрожжи активизировались.
Разлейте квас по бутылкам или банкам, закройте крышками и отправьте их в холодильник на 1-2 дня.
Разлейте охлажденный напиток по стаканам и подавайте к столу. Если закрытую бутылку вынуть из холодильника и оставить при комнатной температуре, то, согревшись, брожение снова активизируется и квас начнет бродить дальше.
Приятного аппетита!

author: {'steamid': '76561198056894849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 312558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4897, 'playtime_at_review': 299723, 'last_played': 1712441116}
review:
Have enjoyed playing this game over the years, although I primarily play it on mobile nowadays since it's easier to pick up and put down throughout the day (little over 1100Hrs on mobile). 

I'd recommend playing if you like Idle games that continuously progress and reset without an "end" in sight, the Challenges, Multipliers and Pets are what keep me coming back to this game (Almost every event that I'm active in I'll purchase an event item or two to show some support and plus it's something cool to give to my pets :p).

Also, the community is active and very helpful in Discord, Ryu along with some of the longer term players have helped shape quite a bit of the ingame content over the years which I think is cool.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067827241', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 441486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20017, 'playtime_at_review': 19233, 'last_played': 1712454552}
review:
Il y a les idle games, et les bons idle games. La différence ne se voit pas tout de suite, mais en persévérant à chasser la galinette (vu le nombre d'idle que je fais il doit bien y avoir un point commun quelque part).

Il me fait penser à Trimps. C'est une découverte perpétuelle, avec beaucoup de possibilités. On se dit à chaque rebirth "tiens mais oui ! Si je fais comme ça c'est mieux". Et bim ! Un nouveau paramètre à prendre en compte (je dis "un" pour ne pas effrayer les sceptiques).

Ce que je trouve énorme : le titre. Mine de rien on arrive vraiment à se sentir tel un Dieu. Parce que quoi qu'il arrive on idle dans le bon sens même sans rien faire, et dès qu'on réfléchit un peu on a plein d'options 

"Dans le bon sens" sauf si on clique sur "oui je rebirth". Alors que le texte est en rouge vingt Dieux ! Avec un message "ES-TU SUR ??" (ps: que tu veux faire cette connerie). Mais OUI je veux vérifier que c'est bien une connerie... C'est fou comme certains ne font toujours pas confiance à Darwin. 

Méfiance également si vous avez une tendance narcissique. Avant de lancer un challenge: assurez-vous des conditions ! Mon grand-père en a lancé un trop confiant. Ca lui a déclenché une arthrite précoce. Depuis il reste assis à prendre des Baal. Comme il dit: "J'ai fait Baal 68 et Baalayé le 69 ! J'ai plus rien à prouver !" 
Que veux-tu répondre à ça ?

author: {'steamid': '76561198077990240', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 14166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14166, 'last_played': 1674430536}
review:
Okay So I have about a few days of active playtime with this game as I've often let this run in the background while doing other things and so have forgotten about it until I remember and check up on it. I've mostly enjoyed my time with it except for some key issues and some issues which I simply can't stand any longer with the game.
I'll talk about the three main reasons why I am stopping with playing this game/idler and why I don't recommend it, 1. I first discovered that it was constantly attempting to connect to the maker's website (shugasu.net) which was getting caught by my protection software as a site that gives off an Error code: SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG message when attempting to connect to it via browser. Which is impossible to stop the program from attempting to do so through the game settings as a result I blocked the application from having any internet access via window's internet outbound rules.
2. Now this is where I found out why the game is not actually a good idler game and why it's constantly attempting to connect to the website, the maker stores your cloud data and saves that enable offline progress it seems (I don't know for sure) as I never got offline progression in this game before I even fully blocked the application, there are not calculations done like in Trimps or Your Chronicle for your offline progression. That added in with the fact that some bits of the game aren't even built that well I believe for an idler make this worse as before you've gotten to beating a certain powerful water god you are rebirthing very often with a few hours between each one, add on that you got new features that takes a few hours to get going with or some that require things you've not unlocked yet means that these new features are useless and barely make any impact at all. I rushed for the divinity generator and by the time I had just begun getting an hour on it's time till empty was I at the point where I needed to reset, but the divinity I had gotten was then useless since it has no effect seemingly on rebirthing. 
3. Graphic card abuse, I don't know why but for some reason whenever I let this game go to above 10FPS in the settings for the AFK mode with black screen or AFK mode off, the game would be attempting to use 80% of my graphics card's 3D capacity when at 10FPS or lower it would use maybe 3-5%. Why? I have no idea but it's been the last straw for me. As I see no reason for a game that's a mobile port to be doing this to a PC.

Okay with that all said here's a few other things that have been bugging me with the game and it's design: Pets are useless in the early game when you first unlock them as they get you so little before you have to rebirth and it's annoying to train them since if the difficulty is too hard the pets stay dead and gain no exp (if you make it too easy then you need more clones than you should spend on them) campaigns are a bit useful if you get lucky; BIG pay to progress aspect with that you have a cap on how many clones you can have that you can increase via god power which is buyable or you can earn maybe....10 at most each rebirth if you haven't met Zeus yet...this cap slows you down alot as you already have to grind up to that cap to begin with which takes a fair bit a time wasted with letting clones die off.
developer_response:
As for your issues with the security concern. 

The error ssl_error_rx_record_too_long might be caused by a wrong browser configuration or an add-on. You can try to delete cookies or browser might not be up to date.

Otherwise the cloud saves are hosted on a shared hoster and some other website which had the same ip had a hacker on their wordpress page which caused some virus scanners so show security warnings for that ip, even if it had nothing to do with my cloud saves.

You can check that even here: https://www.abuseipdb.com/check/188.40.30.32?page=1#report
Currently the confidence of abuse is even 0%, although there was again a brute-force attemt to their wordpress page. I do not use wordpress, though so it is a different user from that shared hoster. I guess shared hosting always has the risk that someone else on that hoster causes problems, but going to a different hoster now or host it myself would be rather time consuming and risks for players to lose their online saves. You could also check https://shugasu.net/ on virustotal or other pages to see that the page is clean.

Also other than some virus scanners not liking that there were hacking attemps on the word press page from the other users there is not issue so far.

review:
先提醒一下，這遊戲沒玩個5、6年我想是玩不完的
我玩了2年感覺還在中期

整體就是不斷解各種挑戰的放置遊戲

author: {'steamid': '76561198035571758', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1839371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7490, 'playtime_at_review': 1454116, 'last_played': 1712452227}
review:
This is easily the best idlegame i have ever played and i have played quite a lot of them.

tldr:
- Many different mechanics/minigames
- Mechanics are interwoven
- Huge room for strategizing and optimizing
- Creative challenges force you to adapt your strategies
- Good sense of progression
- Always something to do
- Customization
- Quality of life mechanics

Gameplay:
The Game has a lot of different progression mechanics and minigames. Unlike other idlegames these mechanics are very interwoven which makes it fun to actually use them. This makes strategizing and optimizing very fun and challenging. This is supported by the huge amount of creative challenges that put different spins on the game and force you to always adapt your strategies.  Lastly one of the most important factor of idlegames: Progression. There is always something to do in ITRTG and you always feel a sense of progress.

Other:
The game has a lot of customization and quality of life mechanics, that help you to optimize your gameplay and automate different tasks. There is still an ongoing stream of updates and new content.

author: {'steamid': '76561199027272214', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 60823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1563, 'playtime_at_review': 1544, 'last_played': 1712449404}
review:
This is the first idler-type game I've ever played and the learning curve was pretty steep, but not insurmountable.  Two weeks in, and I've got the basics worked out and am making good progress!

Lots of options in the game, there's AFK mini games which are fun [the pet card game took some experimenting to finally understand, but now I love it!].  You [i]can[/i] make in-game purchases, but they're not shoved in your face and not necessary to progress in the game.

Really enjoying this!  I'm glad this was my first exposure to an idler game, it's a great one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000305114', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 212662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15442, 'last_played': 1678650604}
review:
If I could give a mixed review, I would. The game starts off pretty slow and simple, with strong similiarities to NGU Idle. It almost seems like a worse NGU. After a few rebirths (read: several hours, maybe 2 or 3 days) the mechanics start to open up more and differentiate it. I tentatively recommend it but I have some gripes.

If you're already a fan of incremental games, you may well like this. You should know, of course, that this is a very long-term game. If you dislike idle/incremental games.... Well, you probably won't like it. 

I'm almost to the end of the "tutorial", defeating the final god, Tyrant Overlord Baal. I can't review the entire scope of the game, as I still have several menus/mechanics to unlock, and the real meat of the game to explore. While I expect to keep playing this for... probably at least several weeks, maybe a few months, I already have some major gripes I would share.

First, guidance and explanation is scarce. I was able to get started without much outside help thanks to tooltips and basic advice from the game's help menu, but I constantly had questions I couldn't find answers to, even when looking online.

Second, the real money transactions. The value is a fcking joke. Can't even call these microtransactions, and you're not getting much in return. They exist solely to suck $$$ out of people with more money than sense, or just too wealthy to balk at the prices. I have spent $60+ on NGU Idle, so I'm not afraid to whale a bit on a F2P game, but I wouldn't even consider it for ITRTG.

Try it if you think you're into this sort of game. Otherwise, you'll probably get bored before it gets particularly interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075990298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1583696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18000, 'playtime_at_review': 876724, 'last_played': 1712455403}
review: I think after nearly 15k hours its finally time to have a review. This game starts out by blasting your face with a lay out that seems extremely cluttered. Once you manage to understand the menu and all the game becomes fun. Its a slower paced idle game where you can just take your sweet time to achieve your goals. I will say if you are looking for one of the faster paced idle games this is not for you. Some challenges take WEEKS to complete but that makes it all the more satisfying once it is completed. The dev for this game updates regularly and fixes bugs as soon as they find them. Overall I highly recommend giving it a try if you enjoy idle games. I am on year 3 or 4 and i still find new things and get that sweet sweet dopamine.

review:
最初の目標を達成した後は小目標の攻略を行うことになる。
この小目標をクリアしている間にも成長しているので、チリツモでいつの間にか強くなっている。
また、小目標以外の要素もプレイヤーの強化につながっており、ペースはまちまちだが右肩上がりで成長できる。
小目標を攻略することに集中することになるので、飽きにくい。

日本語Wikiに必要な情報は書いてあり、英語Wikiも充実している。

author: {'steamid': '76561197994487037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 185668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180744, 'last_played': 1675202016}
review:
ITRTG is a "long-form" incremental - that is, the game will put objectives in front of you and your estimated time to complete some of those objectives might be measured in months or years. Step one is knowing that's what you're getting into. The point is to watch those numbers grow under your care for that long.

It is best approached like a bonsai tree - don't obsess about it on a minute-to-minute level. But it does want twice-daily check-ins for best progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999210377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 7845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7836, 'last_played': 1660548925}
review:
Not surprising, coming from a free-to-play idle game. It's a pay-to-win cash grab hidden behind an indie game, that starts to reveal itself once you get into 100 hours of time investment and realize you've hit a progression wall.  At around this point, the grind climbs to unbearable levels even for an idle game, and you just can't create enough god points to make up for your demands in clones and building speed.

You start thinking about biting the bullet and putting real money to make progress more tolerable. But once you see the prices your heart sinks. You won't see these prices even on triple-A pay-to-win cash grabs. It's beyond comprehension. And it dawns on you why this game's achievements on Steam show such a nose dive right at the beginning.

Don't play this. There are plenty of better offers out there, either completely free after you pay the initial cost on the steam store page (which is still cheaper than some of the most basic pay-to-win stuff in this game), or with a similar business model to this one but with much more reasonable prices.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283654902', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 26497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24975, 'last_played': 1686351100}
review:
Number go up, dopamine go brrrrr.
But for real the game IS a good idle game, it has complexity, but it's not something you can't learn.
But it is LONG, of course an idle game has no given playtime but this game can be played for YEARS and you wouldnt reach 'late game'.
When i first played this on kongergate and defeated the "final boss" I was congradulated for beating the tutorial, that took me like a 100 hours... so yeah it is long.
It isnt a game you can miss out on if you're an idle addict like me, but get ready for a long journey

author: {'steamid': '76561198050607375', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1657845070}
review:
I'm an idle and incremental game fiend - played them all. This is BY FAR the slowest of them that I have ever played. It slows down from the first 30 min, and trust me, it doesn't get any better... I'll leave it on in the background in hopes that it gets fun at some point, but that's a big ask.

Edit: It did not get better. I'm out.

Edit II: Alright, Ryu82, I'll give it another go. Just wish it had more active involvement rather than it almost entirely being a "run it in the background" kind of game.
developer_response:
Sorry if you didn't like it, while it is slow, it is not the slowest game I have played and well it is an incremental game which is meant for years. It is not a game meant for impatient people and you can run it in the background. With only 26 hours played you probably missed 99% of the content.
Most content unlocks after you beat baal and you stopped playing before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094480432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4276, 'last_played': 1657303770}
review: Boring. Not enough useful information, good luck guessing what the free thing does a day, how to take part in the event, why I even should level up the pets or for that matter care about them at all. Progress feels useless as unlocking the many tabs takes far to long... Overall there are far better choices to download in the genre than this. Don't waste your time and just pick something else.
developer_response:
What information are you missing? Pretty much everything has tooltips which explains what it does and on the ?-Page there is lots of info which explains a lot of ingame stuff. And as for the dails free things, you just need to click the icon on top left.. 
If that is still not enough info for you, there is a wiki for the game: https://itrtg.miraheze.org/wiki/Main_Page you can read most of ingame-stuff with additional explanations there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072058136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 99128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9095, 'playtime_at_review': 5219, 'last_played': 1712454705}
review:
Great game!
Fun to play, no competition between players means a helpful and friendly community,
IAPs are *completely* voluntary, nothing shoves them down your throat and if you do spend some money it's not an instant win button but you do feel like you get value from it.
Years and years of content, with more still being added.
Dev is friendly and engages with the community on balance, future content, and just chatting in an active Discord community.

But most importantly, it gives you an excuse to [b]USE SPREADSHEETS!!![/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198227513736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 5887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5887, 'last_played': 1657147553}
review: Mam prawie 100 godzin na liczniku i na początku mi się gra podobała, coś tam się tworzyło, coś tam się trenowało, z kimś tam się walczyło i pokonywało się nowych bogów ale co reset gra stawała się coraz nudniejsza, jak doszedłem do monumentów to nawet nie za bardzo chciało mi się je budować. Klonów nie za wiele przybywa co restart a są wszędzie potrzebne, pewnie te resety trzeba by było częściej robić niż ja robiłem. Ogólnie może znudzić przeglądanie okienek ze zmieniającymi się liczbami i mnie właśnie to znudziło a miałem nadzieje na zaprzyjaźnienie się z grą.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067286140', 'num_games_owned': 736, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 28587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 444, 'playtime_at_review': 28066, 'last_played': 1712440273}
review:
Game uses 8-15% CPU utilization with 4.7GHx 8 cores and 12 threads — consumes ~2-7% of a GTX 1080Ti. It's reported to have a high power usage.. All of which I find suprising for a bunch of text on my screen. 

The gameplay isn't exactly intruiging. You basically just wait — that's the gameplay. Expect to spend a few years with daily check-ins to get anywhere significant. You pick this game up, it's going to take away your focus for some time every day.

So overall, the experience isn't really worth it imo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073059667', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 10136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10136, 'last_played': 1600631729}
review:
[h1]見てくれはよくないけど、内容は最高のクリッカー[/h1]
ゲームをいちいち起動するのが面倒なのでブラウザ版でプレイしています
現在のプレイ時間は9600時間です

良い点
要素がとにかく多く、これに比べるとクッキークリッカーは単調で物足りません
何をしていても少しずつ強くなれるので手探りで大丈夫です
そのうち「このバフが欲しいからこれを目標にしよう」「こいつを育てたいからこの素材を集めよう」等目標も出来てきます
ロールプレイ気味にどの要素から攻略していくか考えるのも楽しいです
頻繁に更新されていて、現役でプレイしていても中々追いつけません

日本語化はされていませんが、日本語wikiが充実しています

悪い点
バランス調整が上手いとも言えますが、クリッカーにありがちなインフレは他よりも緩やかです
視覚的な変化は数字が主になります、派手さを期待するなら別のクリッカーのほうが良いです
イラストにそこまで魅力はありません、作者が頑張って書いているようです

放置ゲーム、クリッカーをいろいろプレイしてきましたがこれが一番出来がいいと思います
クッキーに飽きた方、物足りない方、ハクスラ好きな方に是非おすすめしたいです。

author: {'steamid': '76561199194313717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1151018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18092, 'playtime_at_review': 259230, 'last_played': 1712354340}
review:
This is the top end of the "idle game" genre.  You can set things up, leave it alone for a while, and make progress; fix it up so that you only look in once or twice a day and enjoy your progress like that; or you can play a more intense style and move faster.  The developer gives it loving attention, with tweaks, improvements, special events, and new features, so that even long-term intense players keep finding something new to enjoy.  The setting and story combine good craftsmanship and humor.  The Steam community is good-natured and helpful but also good at avoiding spoilers for people who want to figure things out for themselves. 

If you like idle games, play this.  If you want just one idle game in your life, this one is a good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983726556', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 6625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6613, 'last_played': 1650659006}
review:
not a very fun game, even by idle game standards.
progression is slow, and you have 5-6 different modifiers to deal with.
it's a rebirth style idle game, but you have to rebirth often, so it takes you a long time to get anywhere and do anything.

did you take care of your pets?
did you craft enough shadow clones?
did you fight enough monsters in the fight monster tab (literally just a bar that gets smaller, and a generic monster name (at least ngu idle manages to be quirky and actually funny)
did you defeat enough gods?
did you level attack and defense enough?

did you save up enough god points? you get 3-5 per rebirth in early game, so you need more.

boring menus: the game

developer_response:
Hm not sure what happens for you, I loaded your online save and it works fine.
Maybe there is an issue with your local data. You can try to delete the data at  %appdata%/../LocalLow/Shugasu/Idling to Rule the Gods

author: {'steamid': '76561198882998704', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1735, 'last_played': 1701759900}

author: {'steamid': '76561198039866771', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 363446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 852, 'playtime_at_review': 348089, 'last_played': 1711316227}
review:
This is one of those games that used to be great. And then that one update happened that changed the focus of the entire game. In this game's case, that update was Pets. Now, everything in the game revolves around them. Succeeding or failing at something, or the speed of doing it, is purely a question of the status of your pets. Even your own capabilities are now totally irrelevent, as pets will supercede that progress, too. Nothing else matters, just Pets.

This game was absolutely amazing. Before pets. Before Pets, if you'd asked me, "Should I play this idle game?" the answer was "Why haven't you already? Go do it!", now it's a "Keep looking, there's option options out there."
developer_response:
Sorry if you don't like the pets. Most players like them.
That said, for most challenges you don't need to do much with your pets and the pets are mostly something passive you do on the side. The pet stats do help, but the time you need to spend for your pets is still way less then the time you spend for doing other stuff. I try to make pet stuff mostly idle where you only need to restart their campaigns and dungeons a few times a day.
I will try to add more non-pet related stuff in the future, but in the end the pets are not something I can totally ignore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008775203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 171, 'playtime_forever': 24204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24204, 'last_played': 1648774384}
review:
If you want a firmly mediocre idle game to run in the background with very low system requirements, play this as a 100% F2P title and then put it down later.

Otherwise, fuck this game and fuck this developer. Comically predatory and overpriced microtransactions with regular pressure to buy, minimal work put towards any user friendliness or QOL (and some work directly put towards making should-be-default QOL features worse unless you pay), terrible balance decisions and roadbumps all the way from the core gameplay loop into the minigames (chain captures in Triple Triad are a crime and you are thus a criminal), just a really slow ugly mess. The writing's decent enough for what it is, and there's some cute hidden bits, but the game as a whole is just not a good idler.

author: {'steamid': '76561199114691424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 588933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10905, 'playtime_at_review': 209236, 'last_played': 1712446231}
review: This is actually the game that got me interested in idle games. My computer wasn't great, so there wasn't much I could play, and the storyline sounded cool so I gave it a try and I have been completely hooked ever since. I've yet to find another idler that matches up to Idling to Rule the Gods' standard. I mean, one of the first things I do every morning is check in to see how my little Goddess is doing on her quest to be the strongest entity in the universes. There's a lot to do with it for an idler, and everything has an impact. Some things are slower, and some things you notice the difference in right away. And there's probably a ton of stuff I haven't even unlocked yet. What makes this even more impressive is how lightweight this game is. It runs smoothly in the background no matter what else I'm doing. It doesn't hog resources. I also appreciate the ability to customize the colors and my little character. Plus, the dev is still very active and does a great job with patching up bugs, running semi-regular events, and is still adding new content to the game. It can be a lot to learn, but if you like idle style games, I recommend giving it a try! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198012070359', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 930282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 19691, 'playtime_at_review': 36234, 'last_played': 1712454679}
review:
the good:
there is a comunity that can answer your questions

the bad:
you actually need help from that comunity. 
there is a ton of tooltips, to the point of being anoying. but they do not explain everything
there is an ingame help, an online wiki, but some answers are not what you would expect. 
you can buy certain stuff... after you have enough of a currency to make the option APPEAR in the "shop"

apparently mobile players have an advantage: they can create things offline. 
PC players have a 300% boost that is shorter than 1/3 of the time offline
PC players can't watch commercials to gain god power (unless wink wink)

the name of the game is "idle" but if you are active you actually gain more divinity and a few god power

some things have non mentioned requirements. for example for building a divinity generator you need to beat a certain god... except that is NOT all. you also have to build 1 of all but the last monument, which requires time (and clones to build) and resources

the start might seem slow... until you get to "challenges", "dungeons" etc.
there are other things i have not yet unlocked. 

if you want to read it, the story is cute. repetitive, funny. 
there are so many things and the comunity (and even the wiki) talks about them with just the first letter of the words.

so expect people to talk about CC (creation count), CS (creation speed), GP (god power), Ultimate Baal Challenge (UBC) , BB (black bar, the max speed of doing that activity, after which there is no possible improvement), and whatever CP, DRC, CBC (Clone Build-Up Challenge),  1KC, AAC, PGC,  RTI (and so many more like these) are 

once you get out of the "tutorial", expect things to be more complicated and harder to get

author: {'steamid': '76561197983048598', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 15693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3471, 'last_played': 1647864193}
review:
I want to recommend this so very much but three things have practically murdered my interest; pets, certain challenges, and anti-cheat BS.

Pets start out being essentially useless, like most features. However, unlike other features, you will be spending at least 3 months grinding out pet campaigns to make your pets and their bonuses useful. Likewise, you will often be delaying a rebirth just so you can feed your pets to make their bonuses bigger. Then, you unlock dungeons, another slow burn grind from Hell. Additionally, each individual permanent buy in the Pet Shop takes months of heavy grinding just to afford one purchase. Finally, some of those buys can be bought multiple times.

Pet campaigns run by timers with the lowest being 1 hour and the highest being 12 hours. Most of the time, you'll be rebirthing every hour to push for more God Power farming to buy faster create and build speeds. Also, your pets' growth stats seem to affect the rewards they can bring back from campaigns. For new players, most of the campaigns are fuck-all useless. 

Item campaign? Your 5 pets bring back 100ish pet stones while the most permanent Pet Shop buys cost over 200k pet stones. Food campaign? Excluding shitty free food, all the food you farm here disappears upon rebirth until you farm stones and dungeons for 4+ months to buy the refrigerator upgrade in the Pet Shop. Level campaign? Your pets' levels reset on rebirth and clones are faster leveling. Growth campaign? Useless when you send a 24k total growth pet in with a 4k total growth pet and only see a gain of 6~ total growth after 12 hours. Divinity campaign? Never ran it since it I have the divinity generator. God Power campaign? Useless since a new player's pets can only find a MAX of 1 God Power per pet. Multiplier campaign? Literally the only useful campaign.

Now, lets talk challenges. They're unlocked when you beat the final god, Tyrant Overlord Baal. You're immediately recommended to do the Ultimate Baal Challenge, UBC for short, to unlock the Crystal Factory. This challenge takes a huge steamy shit all over everything you worked to accomplish. God Power and God Power upgrades? Locked away. Pets? Disabled. Might? Suppressed. Crystal Factory? Nope! That big bad army of clones you have? Reduced to the starting cap of 1,000. This challenge is literally as if you had started the game over at the beginning. Oh, wait, no it isn't. It's even harder since those pet multipliers you busted your ass to improve to boost your stats are DISABLED! The dev picked a heck of a way to say "F*** you and the time you invested to get here!". Then, there's the kick in the balls that you have to do the challenge 50 times for the full clear bonus. This is not a challenge. This is Hell.

Finally, let's say you decide to say "screw that noise!" and use Cheat Engine to bypass the garbage mentioned above. Change a single value and your title is permanently changed to "Cheating God/Goddess". If that doesn't bother you, God Power is mildly obscured with a small integer tacked onto the real value of your God Power. Regardless, this effectively means you can't play "your way" instead of the dev's way without the game trying to shame you for it with a stupid title. Nevermind the fact this is a SINGLEPLAYER GAME.

I can not recommend this because of the absurdly long grind times for Pet Shop unlocks, challenge-related bullshit, and anti-cheat bullshit. I don't know where idle devs get the idea that their player base is made of infinite time but we aren't. Lorewise, our character is but we are not. I wish idle devs would hurry up and realize that already.

EDIT: Ok, I gave the game the benefit of the doubt and played for a bit longer. I regret it very much.

This is in response to the dev response in the comment section:

1 hour rebirths are kind of bad? Seriously? So, what is a noob supposed to do when struggling for GP to get a high enough clone count for the factory? Pick 1 of 30~ challenges with rewards that feel lackluster and demand 20-50 completions per challenge? Sit around and do nothing while waiting for UBs to attack while building a black hole for 1 GP on rebirth and picking up 1 GP per hour from a crystal while making more crystals? Around 90% of the game feels entirely dependent on GP buys and UBs do NOT stack up against the gains in GP and Baal Power from clearing P. Baal V40 every hour. Naturally, this isn't even factoring in farming Baal Power for Light Clones to even TRY to make use of the Space Dim.

Now, let me explain why pets got such a harsh review. 3 hours of almost pure waiting just to feed them for...what? 1.5 base growth for 4.5 total base growth with Mighty Food? *rolls eyes* 

Let's do some math using a base Undine in an example that assumes Gold Dragon is NOT unlocked. The example will center around Undine's growth bonuses from being given the required souls and necessary feedings to simply evolve the pet.

Food: Mighty Food with no sauce
DPC bonus: 25%
Growth per feed: 1.875/5.625

Starting T. Growth: -11,111/-33,333
Evolve to V2 for +3,333 T. Growth:-7,778/-23,334
Evolve to V3 for +3,334 T. Growth:-4,444/-13,332
Evolve to V4 for +4,444 T. Growth:0/0
Evolve to V5 for +5,555 T. Growth:5,555/16,665
Evolve to V6 for +5,556 T. Growth:11,111/33,333

This leaves 22,222 T. Growth for the evolution requirement that MUST come from feeding since the Growth Campaign feels like the rewards for the time spent waiting is total shit.

22,222 / 5.625(Mighty Food)=3,951 feedings, rounded up from 3,950.57
3 hours * 3,951 feedings = 11,853 hours
11,853 hours / 24 hours = 493.875 days (1.3 years)

Naturally, this assumes the player will NEVER touch DPC for that 50% max bonus or anything else that affects pet growth. Likewise, this isn't even attempting to factor in the time requirements to craft the souls, farming the dungeon mats needed to craft the souls, farming the nevermelting ice for evolving Undine, or fixing your alchemists who got screwed for unlocking Undine in the first place. Hopefully, you get my point; you're either way far into the game or you get fucked for even TRYING to do anything with Undine.

Side note: There are seemingly zero hints as to where to get Shadow Essence or Magic Shadow Essence. So, you either spoil it with the wiki(like I did), spoil it with advice from others, or stumble across the answer out of pure luck.

Guess what? That 33.3k T. Growth is also leagues ahead of any other unlockable base growth pet by around 8k~ T. Growth. Should I do the math to see how long the above math would take for a pet to gain 8k T. Growth? Sure, let's run the math for some perspective.

Food used: Mighty Food
DPC bonus: 25%
Growth per feed: 1.875/5.625

8,000 / 5.625(Mighty Food) = 1,423 feedings, rounded up from 1,422.22
3 * 1,423 = 4,269 hours
4,269 hours / 24 hours = 177.875 days (6~ months)

So, half a damn year for a noob to gain the first inch towards starting to make campaigns feel worthwhile. Again, this doesn't factor in rerunning DPC or anything else that affects pet growth. Likewise, this doesn't factor in all the time spent running the Food Campaign only to lose all your food on rebirth because you're a pleb who hasn't finished the 6~ month long grind of 1,500 nevermelting ice and 250k pet stones to buy the refrigerator. I'm also not factoring in how rebirthing resets the damn hunger gauge while screwing over campaigns and dungeons either. This isn't even looking at the minuscule gains per feeding in percentage format or how those minuscule gains feel practically worthless.

Hilariously, this is just me mostly talking about how you've padded the grind to improve campaign rewards with absolute shit growth rates for pets. I can also delve into how some of the other features are frustratingly borderline useless when first unlocked, if you'd like. My final point is this; a feature should never, *ever* take a damn year to finally to start showing signs that your work *might* pay off.
developer_response:
It probably would have been easier to look at some guides how to progress faster or join discord to talk and get info about strategies.

While the game is rather slow, it is by far not as bad as you write. The game is a lot about what you do when in this game and how efficiently you manage your stats..1 hour rebirths are kinda bad in almost all cases for example.

An UBC for example is doable within less than a day each if you do it at the right time. It is also only one of a few challenges which takes away most stats temporarily. The first UBC takes a few days longer, but the other 49 are usually done much later and you can finish the other 49 of them within 1-2 months.

Someone who plays with the right strategy can finish everything in the game, get all pets and all pet stone upgrades within 2 years without spending money or cheating. While someone who plays inefficent and does not know what to do would never get that far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045926331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 8923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8923, 'last_played': 1643653414}
review:
I like deeper incremental games that have tons of moving parts, and at first glance that is what Idling to Rule the Gods seems to be. While it does have lots of moving parts, and the base part of the game is very enjoyable, it quickly devolves into a pet micromanaging simulator.

Having to re-level your pets over and over, their differant campaign and dungeon levels, the gear, everything pet related was tedious and I had only just begun with pets. There are tons of pets. With just 9 pets it was just becoming way to tedious to micromanage. I can't imagine what its like once you have unlocked most, if not all of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198981619113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 784, 'last_played': 1656936617}
review: Yes, amazing incremental game great depth, a playstyle fit for most people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124692765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 129176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119998, 'last_played': 1689883101}
review:
The only idle game that I have liked so far.

You are incarnating a weak-ass human that survived a post-apocalyptic war and learnt how to create clones of himself to become strong. You will face gods that are increasingly difficult to beat but doing so will help you progress.
Your first goal will be to beat Tyrant Overlord Baal ; the strongest god.
After beating him, a whole new world will appear to you and you will be able to make your "God" even stronger.

You will never end the game since there is a system of challenges with different rules every time, some take days/weeks, others take hours.

What I like about this game is that even if you are totally stranger to this kind of game you will probably get addicted to it, past the few first hours.

If you are someone that likes to minmax everything, you will have room to do so considering the enormous amount of variables that this game possess. 
If you are someone who just want to chill, well you can do so, your progress will just be slower.

My playtime is at 2000 hours when I write this but when I started I was totally clueless and there were not as many features (4.6 years ago), so I lost a lot of time. It's been a month and a half that I am playing again after 3 years of stopping and I really feel a sense of progression. You should definitely give it a try :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198149582565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1727, 'last_played': 1644291423}
review: For an idle game, there is a ton to do and think about. It's something that I enjoy. It also pairs basic "increase your stats" mechanics with subtle collection mechanics with pets and accessories. Scratches a lot of itches and is satisfying to have run in the background/

author: {'steamid': '76561199107728838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 839, 'last_played': 1643734301}
review:
Idling to Rule the Gods ist ein fantastisches Spiel, das allerdings stark auf Zeit basiert. Den Großteil der Spielzeit wird man afk verbringen, das Spiel läuft im Hintergrund weiter. 

Das Spiel ist größtenteils Interface, wo du Einstellungen machen kannst. Es gibt kein live-play. 
Du bist der letzte Überlebende deines Planetens und hast die Fähigkeit, Schattenklone deiner selbst zu entwickeln. Jedes dieser trägt einen Teil deiner Seele, wenn sie sterben, kehrt dieser Teil zu dir zurück, sowie alle gesammelte Erfahrung. Durch diese Möglichkeit, dich zu stärken ohne dich selbst in Gefahr zu bringen, sowie der Fähigkeit, deine Seele in einen neuen, jüngeren Körper zu versetzen (welches Unsterblichkeit gleicht), wirst du zu einem Gott. In diesen Universen gibt es viele Götter und du stehst ganz unten. Langsam arbeitet man sich nach oben. Jedes Mal, wenn man sich in einem neuen Körper versetzt ("Rebirth"), verliert man zwar den Großteil des Fortschritts, aber je nach dem wie viel man erreicht hat, kommt man sehr viel schneller voran. Das Spiel hat unzählige Möglichkeiten, Spaß zu machen, von Skills über Challenges bis zu Pets, die man trainieren kann und die dann sogar deine eigenen Stats drastisch vervielfachen können. 
Dazu gibt es jedes Mal, wenn du einen weiteren Gott besiegst, ein neues Kapitel der Storyline, das du lesen kannst. Diese sind auch toll und interessant geschrieben und geben dem ganzen noch etwas Tiefe. 
Insgesamt sind die Texte des Spieles ziemlich ironisch humorvoll geschrieben, was das Ganze (zumindest für mich) noch einmal aufwertet.
Definitiv empfohlen. 

Ende des Paragraphs..

author: {'steamid': '76561198048541827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2240, 'last_played': 1643339812}
review:
Fun little idle game until you beat the first final boss "Tyrant Overlord Baal."

Its only once you beat Baal and unlock challenges that you begin to see the amount of time this game expects you to waste.

You unlock several challenges that each reset your progress to zero and expect you to climb your way back up. Each of these challenges would take several days to complete and the rewards are pitiful compared to the amount of time investment.

Couple the idiotic challenges I just mentioned with the absurdly priced micro transactions and I'm left with only one recommendation: STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993213018', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28631, 'last_played': 1698198348}
review: The game itself is good at first. It is very repetitive. Do the same thing over and over and over to get a .01% upgrade and also you are time gated from gains so that you can't get that .01% too fast. Then the Discord community is toxic to certain people. Either you agree with the certain ranked members or you are an outcast. The microtransactions are fine as it is a free to play game and  you don't need any of them to play it. It is very pay to win but its single player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014241544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1643220903}
review:
Press a few buttons, numbers get bigger. Press a few more, and numbers get bigger faster. Turn off the game and come back the next day and numbers are very big. Press yet another button and numbers are now smaller, but growing faster than before. Repeat

No real decision  making or planning is involved with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215929047', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 560914, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11555, 'playtime_at_review': 27609, 'last_played': 1712455773}
review:
ITRTG游戏讨论群：865965429 群内有挑战介绍和时期表格   
欢迎各位玩家友好讨论游戏内容 [url=https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV19e4y1H7dH?share_source=copy_web&vd_source=fa55f083ecc62cca32aaeec94d3ae650] 新手教程 [/url]我尝试做了新手教程视频

游戏本身是一个双线程的放置游戏  你的神明和宠物 两个大系统盘根错杂衍生分支内容 
成为了这个游戏的主要构造(相对于别的增量游戏来说 这款游戏的货币系统相当的保值)
游戏框架在一开始提供了28位耳熟能详的（？）
来自各个神话的神明作为BOSS给你了解你的开始
在今年作者似乎还准备添加一个中后期系统作为第三个大系统  
（已经初步更新了  中后期大型坐牢系统）
后面的内容被我删掉了   但是我撰写了两篇指南在steam社区内 
如果不想加群而是想粗略了解一下的也可以看指南

最后我和作者本人讨论过   
游戏对于各种语言的本地化由于作者仅有一人  且代码需要重写  翻译需要找人  更新需要维护  所以是没有想法的   不仅仅是针对中文  而是所有语种  对于只有英文的现状     
作者并没有歧视任何国家的人   其本身也是德国人

群内尝试了制作汉化补丁  但是限于技术力有限   我们的文件在版本更新后会被直接替换掉   导致工作量巨大  如果有除了联系作者以外的解决办法可以告诉我们捏

author: {'steamid': '76561198025068958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1641507294}
review:
These types of games, when done well, slowly introduce mechanics and interface elements and let you play to figure out what they do and what they're good for.  

This game doesn't understand why this is a good idea, and instead dumps you into a giant UI with tons of things that you have no way of understanding and many UI elements that don't yet have a purpose. This is compounded by the game explaining itself in very poorly written introductory text, and a UI that is just not well thought out.  

A good incremental is a puzzle that you pull at to understand.  This is more of a deadweight that's dropped onto you and you find yourself having to read through confusing text to get some idea of how to proceed. Not a fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065436693', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1641619956}
review: ok so currently im 2.3 hours in, and i've sat here with my calculator, inspecting the best possible route, the cap button is straight cap, it takes 7 years of college in pure mathematics to understand the BASIC concepts of this game. not one individual can spend a singular lifetime to understand even 10% of this game, it takes a lot of collective efforts in order to be as smart and intelligent (like me) as you need to in order to understand the game. im not quite sure i'm ready for the task that lies ahead, and i know i'll have gained 500 pounds of pure muscle (straight in the brain) solely from playing this game. the slaying of gods, oh my god, i disabled the newbie bonus because im not a pussy like the rest of y'all, if you need it to progress? lame, if you ACTUALLY need to ascend? lame. im not quite sure you'll be able to make it in life if your brain isnt actually weighting you down to the point where you need a wheelchair in order to hold not just you, not just your cancer ridden nutsack, but ALSO a fucking wheelbarrow in order to move your brain around, with 6 hefty men, god slaying capable men even if you had to say, but that out of the way; i may have gotten off topic. only advance on the journey of this game if you have 6 phds in the STEM field and be able to have 7 scientific breakthroughs every month, or if you intend to at least brute force the game and realize that your time is done for; you want a girlfriend? not anymore, you want a family? not anymore, you want a job? not anymore, collect those food stamps and get settled, you need to slay gods all day every day. the afk menu? thats wasted experience, if you idle in idle games you're the scum of the earth, for real, this game requires dedicatgion for every second of the game that has been played and you need to be so intelligent with 6.3237 calculators in order to even begin to calculate the expectations of slaying gods, my msucles in my brain are increasing with every second of these 2.3 hours, i've spent the equivalent knowledge of having spent 800 years in university in just 2.3 hours, get out of my way everyone, im coming for that fucking ass.

review: This game is, by far, the most engaging, enjoyable, and plain fun idle game I have ever seen.  The challenges keep the game interesting long after I would have grown tired of most idle games, and I'm continually chasing that next goal.  I highly recommend reading some online guides and/or the discussion boards to get useful tips and avoid some of the mistakes I made which greatly slowed my progress.  However, mostly I recommend giving the game a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991607297', 'num_games_owned': 2133, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 531038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212981, 'last_played': 1703797519}
review:
Finally decided to write a review for this game, this is a hard decision to say if it is a game i would recommend or not since even after this many hours i've only scratch the surface of what this game still has to offer.
I've tried playing the game a few years ago as well and was not attracted since it didn't had any good graphics or didn't seem to have any lore or anything. But now was convinced by a friend to try it again after, he explained to me the basics and where is the lore as well (yes it has a lore) and i've reached the moment where i would play this game even if i didn't had any friends that would play it just to see what else is there to unlock and at some point to read all of the lore which i'm to lazy to finish reading.
The more i play the game the more i notice that it's bigger and bigger, there is a big learning curve and each step you make doesn't feel like the increase gain is big, this game can only be played with small steps and only looking at the bigger picture you would notice that you are becoming stronger. Quite ironic to say that in this game the users knowledge and skill is quite important and not just how strong you are in the game, since you need to understand what you need and when you need, how to upgrade and when to upgrade, overall it's just learning and it's a steep learning curve.
To make everything short and not continue blabbling nonsense i will not recomment this to any kind of people but only to the people who has the patience to learn and continue thru all of the hardships (lots of idle time) this game has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970898913', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 2563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2563, 'last_played': 1638476573}
review:
Incredibly in-depth idle game that has tons of interesting systems and a nice balance between engaging management and automation. As you learn the systems, you can automate various aspects of your play, but there's a good amount of strategy and maual imput to every session (and no pontless clicking – it's a management game rather that a plain time-waster). Also, you can progress both by intensive micromanagement and frequent resets, or very long periods of passive growth, depending on what you prefer.

The visuals are very simple, but the minimalism makes the game light and resposive, while still offering some customisation and flavour that helps it to not seem utterly generic. The developer seems very dedicated and willing to deliver updates. I kind of had my fill after a few days, but I can easily see why people might tinker with this for literal months – even after dozens of hours there are new things to learn and layers of gameplay to uncover, and there are likely to be even more additions in the future. Plus, it's genuinely free with constant feel of progressions, so you shouldn't feel any need to buy stuff unless you want to help the developer. Highly recommended.
