review: Idling to Rule the Gods is a simple idling game,Except its the most thought of and deep one , you start off simply press button to train train, train a lot , fight , rebirth but then you have pets, campaigns , building , creating and so many other stuff that you unlock after tens , hundreds and thousands of rebirths ,which result in the game being able to present you with new stuff for many hours

author: {'steamid': '76561197972743620', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 792, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1637765252}
review:
Basically everything is some combination of poorly worded, poorly laid out, horribly displayed, or some other poor design choice. And for an idle game there's an excessive amount of clicking (including just back and forth through the as-mentioned poorly worded menus) beyond the point where I'd not even consider it an idle game, at least not until you're to the point of 'wait for days for anything to happen'.

If all you're looking is bigger numbers then sure it'll do the job of giving you bigger and bigger numbers. But it's an eyesore, and frustrating for so many reasons, and I can't recommend it at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078753523', 'num_games_owned': 403, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 910321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540654, 'last_played': 1710701526}
review:
Classic idle game that is built on years of features. 6 years after adding Pets, the in-development Pet Village is set to add another layer of depth to one of the biggest sub-systems of the game. Its Quests system is already here, with more features coming soon. This game has plenty of features for the seasoned idler: offline progress, challenges, stacked rebirth multipliers, multi-layered mechanics and systems, shoddy graphics, regular seasonal events, dedicated community and developer, extensive wiki, cloud save backups, and obtuse new player experience. Still has an unmatched AFK mode - you can force a 5 FPS cap, render only a black screen, and at a tiny resolution, so the game hardly makes a dent in your system.

If you're looking for a long term idler, this game might be it. ITRTG has the potential to put you down one of the deepest incremental minmaxing rabbit holes available on Steam. If you want to complete the loads of challenges that have been added (and continue to be added) to top the challenge points leaderboard, or complete achievements, there is enough content and replay value here to keep the most determined satisfied for years.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139336408', 'num_games_owned': 185, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5191, 'last_played': 1636381492}
review: Saw many reviews about this game being amazing but tbh I am really disappointed . Basically it is cheap worse copy of NGU Idle . Waste of time none of the upgrades feel worth it .
developer_response:
NGU was made from an ITRTG player who played ITRTG for years before that. I even helped a bit with making NGU at the beginning. You can check it in NGU in the credits. So it can't be a cheap copy. If anything, it is the other way around.

Also which upgrades don't feel worth it? With only 86 hours of playtime you probably didn't beat baal yet and didn't even unlock most of the upgrades.

It has some similarities and some things are different. NGU is mroe casual friendly, while ITRTG is a bit more hardcore. ITRTG is also a longer game but it is easier to make mistakes and play not optimal.

It might be a good idea to read some newbie guide like here: https://itrtg.miraheze.org/wiki/New_Players_Guide

author: {'steamid': '76561198162232023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1447, 'last_played': 1638156625}
review:
unübersichtlich
schlecht erklärt

developer_response:
Ich versuche das Spiel möglichst übersichtlich zu gestalten und alles ist eigentlich erklärt, entweder in tooltips oder Infoseiten, oder auf der ?-Seite und der Wiki gibt auch viel Hilfe zum Spiel.
Falls etwas besser gemacht werden kann, bin ich immer über Feedback dankbar, aber das Spiel hat sehr viel Umfang und es ist recht komplex, daher ist es nicht möglich es so einfach und übersichtlich wie 0815 Spiele zu machen.

Auch ist das Spiel kompelett bis zum Ende spielbar, ohne auch nur einen Cent dafür zu Zahlen, tausende von Spielern haben das gemacht, daher ist das P2W eine Lüge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971951603', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 727658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 688975, 'last_played': 1711577801}
review:
The Halloween Event doesn't work, and some of the Achievements are broken, but this is an AMAZING game.
It starts out like any other idle game, train up, so you can learn better trainings, to kill Gods and monsters, then reset the world when you can't get any farther.
But as you get deeper in, it keeps unlocking new mechanics:
Pets
Crafting
Dungeons
and of course, Challenges!
One important difference about this game from any other idle game: You can actually come back weaker from a resetting! All other games, you get unilaterally stronger every time you reset, this one allows you to go down, and some of the Challenges take away your bonuses from previous resets!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046979629', 'num_games_owned': 1476, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 84932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77086, 'last_played': 1708030390}
review:
it is a fair bit buggy and can be more streamlined. But in general, even for idle games, it just takes too long. Unnecessarily so. And most of the challenges ain't even challenges, they unnecessarily reset your progress for little reward in the long run.


Also, Increased achievements. Rip progress for no reason.
developer_response:
What do you mean with buggy? When bugs are reported I usually fix them rather fast and afaik the game has not many bugs, if so, only small and barely notable bugs. Most "bugs" are when a player misunderstands something, but if bugs are not reported I can't help with that.

Also the game is long, that is right, but that challenges give little reward is just not true.
Beating the challenges hugely increases your power in the end. And challenges don't really reset your progress, only some parts of it, which you get back rather fast. But the game has a lot of strategic choices and if you do the wrong challenges at the wrong time, or rebirth too slowly, you progress a lot slower in the end. 

Also the increased achievements was something a lot of players wanted and I only added them because of that. I also have no idea how more achievements reduce any progress. It just means you can get more than before and not less.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982953477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 533126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 9391, 'playtime_at_review': 91740, 'last_played': 1712449278}
review:
This idle game is probably the best idling game I have ever played. Of course you can play idle games as you like, but there are also other mechanics and complexity for those who want to delve into it. When I say complexity, it's not very "complex," but there are many mechanics to allow you to play exactly like you want.
Another thing I like about this idle game is it has more of a community model rather than a "pay to win" type. For example, Patreon supporters do not only benefit themselves, they benefit everyone equally (to my understanding). Like right now, I have various (not over the top) boosts due to others' contributions.
Also the Discord server is very friendly and helpful!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072740436', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1638682764}
review: The best idle games break down what I actually like most about arpgs or mmos into a more simple form. Idling to rule the gods does this, while somehow still being very engaging. Unlike most idle games it's fully playable offline , but also has online saves. I mostly play this on android, but Steam client is pretty much exactly the same.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152627199', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 989214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936674, 'last_played': 1695724121}
review:
This game became boring, have principal problems and I feel tired of it. Let's analyze step-by-step.

1) Challenges, that rewards you something permanent for complection. Rewards for single complection often too small for making notable change, so, you need to complete most challenges several times. Is it problem? By itself- no, there are many different challenges, the entire gameplay you spend time during challenges. Problems appear with fact- you need to click insane times to complete some challenges- so, even if you are allmighty god, you cannot finish easy challenges by idle- you need to manual click every action. How many times it can be fine even taking into account the rest from the game? Answer  is disappointing.
2) There are simple lottery system, lucky draw. The best reward- 300.000 pet stones- have very low chance (≈0.17%), but partially nigilates by high draws count. I had noted, that for a season I was very lucky- probability worked from week to week. But last 4 months of everyday gaming I had no procs! What is it? Balancing bug of old broken increased probability? Donation luring? Random?
If it just true RNG then garant system should exist, like lucky draw pet from 2000 draws. I have decreased feeling of joy from very often drops and increased feeling sad from no procs from month to month.
My own, may be wrong opinion: I don't believe it was RNG.
3) Pet manipulation requires a lot of clicks. Some time ago campaing start was drastically simplified, BUT there are dungeons (you need to claim rewards, feed pets, choose dungeon, (time optionally) and click start for every dungeon team! Restart dungeon button is useless as long as requires even more clicks!) and recently released pet tavern activities, that requires individual pet choosing and if necessary, replacement! Every day!
4) Ingame changes can be proposed by discord voting. I was able to offer implemented new challenge (True God Skip Challenge, hey), but my offer to very slightly reform the third point met opposition. Why? Because voters usually are game lovers which are very loyal and conservative. Idlers meet future, but ItRtG stays in 2016, it doesn't matter if the game has a lot of mechanics if the basic ones exhaust the player. As a result, recent steam reviews show minimum new player interest.

As a conclusion. Only reforming able to save this great game with big perspectives. Slowness is not a problem only if minimum player actions required- but now, game will exhaust you. At first glance it is clear that the creator is not even trying to play this game. Idle games shouldn't be work, but relax. No old player would leave after simplification and automatisation of game actions, so what's the problem?
I will return only after automatisaon were implemented.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030962840', 'num_games_owned': 16, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 88348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28986, 'last_played': 1640250420}
review:
In addition to the 4 Kilobyte File Size fix for the Creation Pre-requisites patch of less than 500 lines of code which is missing, which is quite simply a Sum total of the various parts which can be calculated across an entire spreadsheet, extremely easily, with one side of the Spreadsheet being used to calculate the constituent parts, whilst the other side of the table is displaying the desired values based on the desired quantity, meanwhile the desired Quantity is a Player Given Variable, which just shows that you have no concept of what you are doing with your Mathematics, even after working on this issue for the past 5 years, because I E-mailed you about this bug in 2017, it is now almost 2022.

Additionally, your Distribute buttons are not uniform in their behaviour; as the Pets Clones will Distribute "to Capacity of" whilst the Divinity Generator Upgrades are Distributing "additional clones", which means 5000 Pet clones will always Distribute up to 5000, however; 5000 Divinity Generator Upgrade Clones will distribute another 5000 clones each time you press the button. This lack of uniform programming, lack of modularity, and lack of progressive thinking which builds an incremental Game using proper Mathematics as the foundation for constructing literally everything else, this is why despite having over 7 years where you built this big game; you are barely earning enough to cover Rent, Food, & Bills, per month. I checked your Patreon, you are earning less than $700 USD per month, even with Ad Revenue you aren't earning more than roughly 60 Hours per Week in USD at Minimum Wage.

If I were you, I'd have at least 150% of that monthly income, because I'd have built something that functions properly, not this "I refuse to fix this basic fundamental issue, such as just blatantly not calculating entire branches of pre-requisites because 'I don't feel like fixing this super complex problem that nobody can help me with because I don't allow any of my Code to be accessed as Open Source, not even to help me fix an error' because 'I' spent months fixing this error already and refuse to waste any further time on it", which was basically what you said 5 years ago in your E-mail to me.

If you had fixed your game 5 years ago, you'd very likely be earning over $1,000 per month from the Patreon Profits currently, because I instructed you to fix something that you are introducing yourself with; Pre-Requisites for Creations, the entire first few rebirths are built entirely around creating, which heavily makes use of the Pre-Requisites functions, which means that round the time you are asking for money; people are seeing that you need only 2 Sky to build the 100 Planets, each one using 1 Night, each 1 Night using 2 Sky to build, in order to build an entire Solar System! 1 Night to build 100 Planets to build an entire Solar System? Are you sure that's functioning properly? 1/100=0.01 Night per 1 Planet, does that sound accurate? Because each Planet is requestion 1.00 Night, not 0.01 Night.

Did you even attempt to test this yourself even once before publishing the update? I don't care if you are required to rebuild this entire section of the Game because the Code is so old that you are no longer familiar with the mechanics used in that section; good riddance to bad code, use better code this time, code that you can easily sift through, fix any future issues, get your code organized, and then you will not have further issues because you built everything upon a solid foundation with plenty of redundancies and error catching with error correction...right? For your sake; I hope you built using stable code, because otherwise this is going to go very wrong very fast because of improper code-building.

Brackets are the only universal Mathematical Formulae Constant, NOT "PEMDAS" or whatever other other names you may recognize the Acronym as, because there's another which performs Multiplication BEFORE addition, not to be confused with performing Addition before Multiplication, thus; Brackets are the universal constant, because; Brackets are explicit: there is no second-guessing, no guess-work.

(10+9-8*7/6) can be read as ((((10+9)-8)*7)/6) or (10+(9-(8*(7/6)))) or (((10+9)-8)*(7/6)) or ((10+9)-(8*(7/6))). However; just one of those is accurate. Fix your Math, fix your Code, fix your GUI, fix your Game, and THEN if you apologize, I might consider sending you money, but I'm not paying you for a broken object. I wouldn't pay $150,000 for the rusted frame of what used to be a Ferrari. I might pay $150,000 for a Ferrari, but not for a broken Ferrari.
developer_response:
Sorry if you don't like my game, but I feel like you don't understand this game, or games in general. Maybe it would be a good idea to join discord and talk to other players a bit.
Games are not math and don't need to be correct in everything and realistic. Game mostly need to make fun and give the players a feel of progression. As long as a game is fun for a player and the player feels a sense of achievement and progression, the basic princible of a game is there.

While I try to fix bugs when they are reported, I also need to manage my time and evaluate it if it is worth to fix it or not. As for your creation prerequisites issue, well sorry to say that, but to fix that would be very time consuming and I don't have the time. It is also a very minor display issue which doesn't effect the game at all. Almost nobody even looks at that. And spending a lot of time to fix this would be a bad business practice. In the end I need to make sure the game makes enough money to be able to live from it, so I need to priorize things which actually can either make money or keep most players longer to the game. Fixing a minor, but time consuming thing is not something like that.

Also about that spread button, it adds the value you did input in the input value for clones to use, which is the same behaviour for any page with a spread button. The distribute button for the clones is named differently and is not really compareable to the other things. Pets and buildings are something totally different.

If you feel like you can do it better and make a better game, feel free to try that, but your assumptions about the money I make from patreon and the game are quite a bit wrong and far from the truth. I won't say how much I make with it, but I can say it is far above minimum wage, otherwise I would not work on it anymore, I couldn't afford that.

author: {'steamid': '76561199113807696', 'num_games_owned': 1286, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3596, 'last_played': 1629552744}
review:
Honestly a great game for a free to play idle game. After almost playing 60 hours, I am not even surprised that people have thousands of hours in this game. 
There is insane amount of stuff to do even though it's just an idle, incremental game. Like I defeated tyrant overlord Baal who is sort of like the strongest god in the game (at least in the main story) just recently and I feel like I just barely finished a part of the tutorial. The player literally has rookie boost till you beat Baal for the first time.There are still so many challenges, pets, features I haven't unlocked yet.
I always want to play a little longer. Let's say, I used the rebirth option. I feel like let's wait some to create clone up to limit, then after getting some stats, attack gods, focus on getting lot of divinity and making creations. Then I started building monuments till divinity generator. Then use the generator to get more divinity and make more creations, upgrading my monuments, sending the pets to dungeons, unlocking might, upgrading might, then releasing might to increase stats greatly and beating more gods. Then all my stats are in green, then I rebirth and I start again. Even though there is offline progression, I don't even know how I already have that many hours.
The story is okay though it's not completed yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995317130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 768711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 10970, 'playtime_at_review': 26650, 'last_played': 1712427105}
review:
Von den ganzen Idle/Clickern auf dem Markt klar mein Favorit. Das Spiel ist auf Langzeitmotivation ausgelegt und hat JEDE MENGE zu tun. Eine klare Empfehlung wenn jemand nicht weiß, wo hin mit seiner Zeit. Ich habe 438 Stunden auf dem Timer und bin immer noch ein ziemlicher Anfänger, auch wenn sich die einzelnen Meilensteine jedes mal nach einem großen Schritt anfühlen. PROs haben schon Jahre investiert. Durch ein Onlinesystem erhält man passive Boni durch sie.

Letztenendes muss man keinen Cent reininvestieren. Einige Käufe bieten jedoch einen enormen Nervenkomfort. Ich habe mir nach etlichen Stunden selbst gesagt, dass ich für die enorme Dauer meines Spielens auch mal ein paar Euro investieren kann und es hat sich gelohnt. Ich rede hier von permanenten Langzeitverbesserungen.

Die Pay-to-Win Käufe, die ein wenig Spielzeit verkürzen sind meiner Meinung nach ihr Geld nicht wert und überteuert. Man kann sie leicht ignorieren und es wird nichts aufgedrängt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095001217', 'num_games_owned': 1330, 'num_reviews': 634, 'playtime_forever': 8180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1631, 'last_played': 1629135657}
review:
A surprisingly deep and complex idle game, yet its depth and complexity bring about a certain level of satisfaction. Someone who is a casual player and/or new to idle games may find this game overwhelming as a result.

The game eases you into its many systems and mechanics as you progress further into the game. It also has a neat feature where it temporarily boosts your progress until you reach a certain point of the game, which does help out a lot for the initial starting grind. While overwhelming at first, the menus typically housing a feature each are thoughtfully created as each system meaningfully engages with other systems and the overall feel of the game itself. It doesn't demand a lot of your attention, barring when you first unlock a new feature and experiment with it. A lot of the automation features is available to you free of charge at the start, with a decent amount of customization as well. The wait time between each progression wall is fairly reasonable; if you play your cards right using the automation features and simple planning before you leave the game to idle, you generally can expect sizable progression after each idle session. And if things get too hard to figure out, there is a relatively friendly Discord community too. 

If you like complex idler games and generally like to min-max systems for efficiency, this one is perfect. And even if you don't, I think it is still worth giving it a shot if you're looking for a new idle game to try.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975759821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 796084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 795030, 'last_played': 1657799864}
review:
It's the deepest Idle Game ever, and it comes with a lot of humor and eastereggs. It is also the one and only idle game, where you can reduce the CPU usage almost to zero, without even closing the game. On top of that, it is created by the worlds most friendly and committed dev ever.

You will see a lot numbers, and early in the game it might be confusing so you might want to either read up basics or just take some time to dig into the game mechanics. This idle Game also gives always the impression, that you are making progress, because progress is not totally linear, unlike in many other trashy idle games, you will in ITRTG always be able to feel your progress, so it is motivating to make you play more. I could not write about the game mechanics for hours I guess, but instead I will only keep it at the impression, this game has made on me, because the overall mechanics are just too many, and there are already plenty guides, where you can read them up.

If you want to make long term experience with an idle game by clicking a bit here and there every day but not investing too much real life into it, then you will find what you are looking for if you decide to play ITRTG.

It will NOT help you find a Girlfriend and NOT grant you SUPERPOWERS in life but it will still make you happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323176594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 802799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25728, 'last_played': 1702288230}
review:
I'm leaving this review as someone who is relatively new to Idle games and whose first exposure to the genre was NGU IDLE. As a disclaimer, I'm still in the "early game" (having defeated Baal) but I'm pretty sure even playing optimally getting to this point would take most players a month or so so make of that what you will.

Overall this game basically "requires" you to be hardcore into IDLE games, it is a very slow starter and the grind seems to have no end. It's a game you can play for a very long time for better or for worse. As far as active play is concerned the game does more or less push you to log in at least once a day and is not very forgiving towards extended IDLE play (In my opinion this is one of the weakest aspects of the game as I at times enjoy the freedom to play IDLE games on a longer schedule). The depth of the game systems is impressive within the IDLE genre and so it is well suited for types who like to optimize (although I think the slow pace of the game might actually turn the optimizers off more than the challenge of optimization brings them in). The UI is a little bit clunky but it functions (at least after you get used to it), visually it's nothing to write home about but it's above par among IDLE games (many of whom don't even have graphics). 

So how does it compare to NGU IDLE? NGU IDLE, while being similarly slow, is better paced overall and seemingly more feature rich (although ITRTG is by no means feature poor, also the pet feature in ITRTG seems to have a lot of meat to it). The progression also seems to be generally more exciting in NGU as you are constantly getting tangible rewards such as equipment, unique perks, new features etc. as opposed to just watching your numbers go up in ITRTG. ITRTG has surprises too but they are more infrequent (although I'm sure I haven't even scratched the surface there). I realize ITRTG is the inspiration for NGU but nevertheless the point stands that NGU arguably surpasses the original.

If you can only play one I would have to direct you to NGU but if you are looking to commit to a game long term and have the patience to engage with the game daily ITRTG is at least worth looking into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090290117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1090564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 15881, 'playtime_at_review': 795749, 'last_played': 1712386949}
review:
At the time of writing this comment, I'm only . . . *checks notes* 13,261 hours into this game . . . on Steam. I started playing this game on a different platform. I suppose its time to write a review though.

Tl;Dr: Fun game that lets you play when you want, and rewards active and idle playstyles. If you like Idle games, do yourself a favor and pick up this game.


I have played a variety of Idle games over the years, and this is the only one that has kept my interest - although Cookie Clicker is 2nd.

Why is this game still so fun to play, even years later?

It rewards both active and idle playstyles, without feeling like you're being punished for switching between them or using one more than the other

The 'base' game, defeating Baal, takes a decent amount of time and is really fun, but the 'end' game has basically unlimited replayability. There's dozens of different challenges, which provide stacking bonuses, and not only are most of the challenges fun and different, but the bonuses are also very desirable. 
Some of these challenges are beatable in hours, and some take over a month (or even longer, if you don't have time/perfect setup). 

Other than some confusion over the game being about making 'shadow clones' and then the first resource being 'light' (which I thought were 'light' clones for a while), the game explains pretty well what you should be doing at any given point, and gives you enough variety of options to be interesting, without being overwhelming. 

That said, the game has added about 10 new tabs of gameplay since I originally started, so the learning curve could be more difficult than I recall.

I think one of the things that really helps this game stay fun after all these years is that even though a lot of the numbers get super high and can start to lose meaning, and even after you start to get lost in all the challenges, you can still see how much *real* progress you have made by comparing one number: Highest God Defeated, which even people who are considerably further than me in the game are still only in the low triple digits of. Don't worry though, lots of other numbers get silly high :) 

I'd recommend this game to anyone who has anywhere from 30 minutes a week to check up on their idle progress, to someone who is able or willing to spend hours a day micro managing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029942403', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1252182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4057, 'playtime_at_review': 360219, 'last_played': 1712455554}
review:
Thinking I should write a review after 6000 hours seems fair.

TLDR: Game is good, would recommend if you like idles.

Overall the game is one of the better idle games out there in terms of content and the way things interact with each other. The game is fairly straight forward on the surface but can get complicated when looking at the finer details/optimizations you can do. Thankfully there is a lot of discussion and help over on the discord and wiki if you do need that extra little help (which I really did)

author: {'steamid': '76561197982406281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 48841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12855, 'last_played': 1699848974}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972452370', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1644, 'last_played': 1640386519}
review:
Imagine NGU Idle but without the adventure mode, and with confusing mechanics, and with tooltips that have needless math formulas. It's got pets, but if you need a wall of text to explain something, it shouldn't be in the game.
Oh, and it rips off FFVIII/FFXIV's Triple Triad in the minigames.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055716027', 'num_games_owned': 2286, 'num_reviews': 539, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1612038784}
review: schmutz! es gibt viel bessere idle games !
developer_response:
Please tell me the games who are better. I'm sure because you played this game for a few minutes where you have seen 0% of the content you can tell why others are better.

While there are always better games out there, I would say this game is one of the better idle games. There are almost no other idle games with as much depth and content as this game. It is also free and a player can reach everything for free, which isn't true for a lot other games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995035524', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 61699, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12550, 'last_played': 1665750054}
review: game is stupidly immersive, i played it on a whim 3 years ago then actually left it and uninstalled. when i came back i had still made progress, trillions of imaginary numbers of progress and when i applied all that my character had gained i still couldn't beat half the gods, then after playing it for less than another month regularly i made insane progress in terms of scope and only just discovered the pet system, the active battle system which actively lowers the amount of clones you need to waste on skills, the divinity generator, might unleashes and even 2 separate AFK games if you want to idle harder while you idle that also progress your actual account. and then the crown jewel revealed itself. the story line! even though this is an almost entirely text based game with fairly mediocre art you can also read what your character went through (up to the battle with Nyx currently)  in a relatively high quality chapter based book essentially that reads like a manga and has some really cool concepts that put an insane journey to all your ludicrous numbers and bars. i still haven't beaten the final boss and as best i can tell from the other tabs in game he has at least 100 scaling incarnations plus secret bosses, challenge dungeons, pet evolutions and probably a ton more i wont mention, forgot or don't even know of yet. bottom line you can play it forever and then not play it whenever for free. if any of this piques your interest play it for 2 hours turn all the auto buy and auto train tabs to on and close it. if you ever come back there will be tons more to play with with literally no effort and still no end in sight or imagination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075324976', 'num_games_owned': 909, 'num_reviews': 689, 'playtime_forever': 24665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11619, 'last_played': 1682488077}
review:
If it's not clear from the title: This is an idle game. It's very much "hurry up and wait" and then wait some more. There is nothing to it other than what you see in the screenshots. A collection of stats to meddle with and then wait, wait some more and then see some numbers go up.

So obviously if you don't want an idle game, stay far away from this. However, if you do like idle games this has some reasonable depth and a quirky sense of progress that you can fiddle with occasionally and then just leave it… idle, while you go do something else.
---

Bottom line: idle games in general are not for everyone, but if you are into idle games, there's a lot worse than this out there.
---

author: {'steamid': '76561198111297367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 388382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7737, 'last_played': 1699873358}
review: Was good at first, but if you rebirth too many times it completely resets your multipliers to the original state, making this game a complete waste of time. Don't even bother with this game to be honest. Not even worth playing--even for achievements. I was dumb enough to waste $5 on a pet stone just to find out the pet does fuck all to help you out. Game is utter shit, wait for a CE script for it to get achievements.
developer_response:
The rebirth multipliers are only temporary boosts to help you in the short run, but you need to go for the permanent boosts for a more permanent progress. And how many multis you win or lose depends on when you rebirth, so you need to do so in the right time.
Pets are also really useful if you use them right and care for them.
You might want to read some guides to progress faster and make your pets useful like in the wiki: https://itrtg.wikia.com/wiki/Idling_to_Rule_the_Gods_Wiki or join Discord, where there are many players who can help you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198222627032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1610975226}
review: This is gross that the game uses patreon monthly purchases when you could make dlcs and not always ask money from the players.
developer_response:
What is gross here?
None of the patreon boosts gives boosts to only the patreons, they give boosts to all players. So if there are patreons, they help you to progress faster. 
It is also not really needed to do so. Patreons are solely players who want to support the development and I'm nice to give out boosts to all players because of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979221633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 1066859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 11947, 'playtime_at_review': 139594, 'last_played': 1712455591}
review:
This is the one incremental game to rule them all. I played so many different incremental games and this is truely the crown jewel of the genre.

The complexity, the strategy, the continued support, the helpful community, incredible longevity, all this make this the best incremental game out there.

Be warned thou, this is not Clicker Heroes nor Adventure Capitalist where you understand the game after 5 minutes and complete it a couple months later. This game will end life as you know it and keep you on your toes for years. Even after thousands of hours you will still unlock new things and discover new subsystems which singlehandedly outshine whole other games of the genre in terms of mechanics and depth.

If you want one incremental game to sink your thoughts and time into for years to come without having to find a new one every month because your current idle game is boring, you have your solution right here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198814930892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 442851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 425880, 'last_played': 1688047079}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991152201', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1151325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106387, 'last_played': 1709248346}
review:
I mean, it's not bad.
I have a couple of hours into it, nothing major.

Actual review:

This is probably the best idle game I've ever laid my hands on.
Everything in the game can be acquired for free, no micro-transactions are ever forced upon you.
The only "downside" to it is that the beginning is quite slow until you complete your first UBChallenge.

The game has lots of lore, a written story (actually kinda interesting too) and a lot of cool features so there's always something you can do. Run dungeons with your pets, craft items to make your god and your pets stronger, craft a refrigerator to keep your food between rebirths, etc. etc.

If you are into idle games, this one will not bore you for a long, long time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089605158', 'num_games_owned': 65, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 793301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793301, 'last_played': 1610464738}
review: loved the game for years, dropped it for another few years, tried picking it up and my online save was gone. very immersive game but the server backend had frequent problems even when i played it. rip my turtle friend
developer_response: Sorry if you lost your save, but the game gives free pet stones if you do a manual save every day and hints towards that the server saves are a backup which usually works but to make sure to not lose your save it is best to do manual saves every day. So the players always have it in their own hand to keep a backup. You can even connect the game to different platforms to have multiple backups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002348176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 442200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61037, 'last_played': 1632955761}
review:
It's one of the better idle games, but it's still an idle game. My recommendation is contingent on you being willing to commit to playing an idle game, twice a day, nearly every day, for at least the next several months.

Pros:
- One of the most complex idle games around without the mechanics feeling gimmicky
- *Almost* everything can be obtained eventually thru gameplay alone
- Offline progress works for *most* things at the same rate as online, if you open it at least every 12 hours
- Holiday events make it much less frustrating to unlock certain things (mostly "Pet Tokens" and pet-related things)
- The developer personally responded to my original review, explaining how to mitigate my originally perceived flaws with the game

Cons:
- It's easy to slow progress while using offline progress by forgetting to reopen the game at least every 12 hours
- The existence of non-cosmetic mtx / in-game purchases / microtransactions destroys the possibility of competitive play
- Some mtx items ("TBS for challenges", "Improved Campaign Cancel"[strike], and "Custom Pet Clones"[/strike]) [strike]seem[/strike][b]are[/b] impossible to obtain via gameplay alone
- It's still an idle game

Note: I checked the "received this product for free" box because it's "free" in the Steam store and I haven't paid for any mtx items.

Original review:
It's a decently complex idle game, but the "must be online for full progress" requirement greatly inflates the playtime stat. Prepare to wast 5% as many hours as playtime indicates, counting spreadsheet time. Also beware of mtx walls, tho they're softer than in some other games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218140348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 25542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17773, 'last_played': 1608297181}
review:
Uses too much CPU, it will literally crash your computer if you leave it running in the background after hours. Be warned.

It's also getting p2w these days. Devs paying more attention on the existing oldies instead of caring about the newbs. It's addicting at first, but bad experience for me overall.

Active play is strongly rewarded, despite the "idle" name. You will gain far more progresses while online and checking in every now and then than staying offline. There are still large walls in advancement that will take a lot of time to get past, I mean a lot. Sounds fine right? The truth is it's repetitive and boring af, it's asking you to do the same boring task you've completed over and over again. Beat Baal, rebirth and beat Baal, rebirth and beat Baal x99999. Watching the pain dry on my wall is literally better than playing this game.

Edit: Devs just responded lol. I don't like the lies they try to push in my face; it's only aggravating. Nobody likes them and all they do is damage control and attempting to downplay your criticism. 

So in response to this, no it's p2w. Sure you can get the stuffs, say refrigerator by grinding instead of paying $$, but well, get ready to grind it out for years, if that's not p2w, I don't know what is.

Yeah, we can 'get almost everything in offline progress', except it's like .3 of what we're supposed to have normally. If that's what you call 'almost', well I guess you can say that I am 'almost' old at 10 years old. Let me give you another example, skill capping from active play requires 15-16 days, if you let the app run in your background it takes 90 days (1 min per usage cap), if you go offline it'll take 270 days (3 mins per usage cap). Literally about a year difference between idling and active play and you call that 'almost'. I can give thousands more examples but I am too tired to list down every single thing.
developer_response:
The cpu usage of the game is usually not very high, but if it is high for you, you can reduce the frame rate and go to the afk page. There is also an option to hide everything which reduces the cpu usage to very low levels while the game progresses fully.
And you also get almost everything in offline progress.

Also no idea what you mean with p2w because you can reach everything in the game for free and I didn't add any new purchases lately while I often make things easier for newbies. That said, older players play the game for much longer and run out of content, while the content is already there for new players. This means for new update the main focus has to be for older players. Still every new addition also makes it easier for newbies. I  take extra care that nothing I add makes existing things harder.

Anyway if you have suggestions for improvements, there is always the feedback option and the suggestion channel in Discord. If people don't say what they don't like I can't do anything to improve it.

And you also get almost everything in offline progress.

Also no idea what you mean with p2w because you can reach everything in the game for free and I didn't add any new purchases lately while I often make things easier for newbies. That said, older players play the game for much longer and run out of content, while the content is already there for new players. This means for new update the main focus has to be for older players. Still every new addition also makes it easier for newbies. I  take extra care that nothing I add makes existing things harder.

Anyway if you have suggestions for improvements, there is always the feedback option and the suggestion channel in Discord. If people don't say what they don't like I can't do anything to improve it.

Edit:
Please don't write crap which is untrue.

P2W = you need to pay money to win, which you don't need to do here. The game never asks you for money or even advertises it. A player literaly needs to search for it and playing the game actively helps way more than purchasing something.

The offline gain is 98% the same as the online progress, you just need to play once in a while, too, to send your pets to campaigns, dungeons and feed them because that needs to be done every 12 hours at least.
As for one-capping the skills, it is even faster if you go offline and then online for a 300% speed boost every day. It is doable within a month or two, if you do it right.

And of course the game doesn't do rebirths or do any strategic play you might need to progress faster automatically offline, but you can't really expect that.
All in all it is still a game to be played, while it can be idled for quite a bit it doesn't mean it plays itself without the need to do anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053183157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 177335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 22, 'playtime_at_review': 127785, 'last_played': 1712453761}
review: This is a good idle game that does not take a lot of your time yet at the same time can entertain you for hours if you desire. There are however some bugs that I have yet to see a fix for. One of the biggest being offline mode compatibility.  If you play online then load the game offline weather with prior knowledge or not, it will load the last saved spot with no progress in respect to time since last login resulting in potential hours, days, or even weeks of lost progress. I've found this bug to be in play while in full online mode as well but with less frequency.  This bug is triggered both on PC and mobile and can be the result of lost connection or while in a location with no online services.  So to sum up this review, this is a definite go to game for anyone but just be mindful of your connection to online services.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211304927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 146789, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18461, 'last_played': 1705468391}
review:
Treat this game as a plant!
Watch it grow slowly but steadily, and you'll have so much fun!
Don't get me wrong with my playtime, I actually have been playing this game longer but I only started to play on steam just a while ago.

The game itself is so complex that you'll have to explore.
So many tabs! So many progress bar! So many upgrades! And above them all... so many pets!
It's just as addicting as treating your plant but yes of course, gardening is not for everyone.

If what you're looking is just a mindless tapping auto game which plays itself and a little game mechanics, this game is not for you. Yes I'm looking at you guys mindless idle auto games with glamorous waifu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333405055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 7536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1776, 'last_played': 1684104893}
review:
When I first saw screenshots and ratings I was like "these guys are insane" and closed it.
After some time I got bored again, remembered this game and decided to gave it a try. I launched game at a autumn and don't remember how it got to summer : |
(I played with steam off, so time-spent is inaccurate)

This game is idle, sure, but it's not your tupical "click single button while being braindead" type of idle clicker.
Game has insance amount of depth. When you think you saw all it has to offer, it shoves new layer of content at you.
Also I must note, it's free-to-play game with 'items' shop in it, but these 'items' aren't OP and I personally never felt like game won't progress if I don't buy them.
ITRTG was far from being my first idling game, so at that point I already was pretty sturdy agains these type of games addiction. But it still got me for good. If you are easily prone to gaming obsessing, you better don't play it.

In the end I got out of addiction. Sure from a side viewpoint it sounds like a waste to spend almost a year in idling game, and probably it is a waste, but I had a lot of joy and writing this review half a year after quiting just because of fond memories of this game.

Resulting score: addiction/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198142981330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 517951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303478, 'last_played': 1711124548}
review:
So this review is gonna be rather throughout. If you want a short yes/no answer if this game is worth checking out the answer is yes (says the guy with over 5k hours as of writing this).

The most important thing to know about this game is probably the pacing. The pacing is in my opinion the weakest part of this game as it does start of rather slow - it does pick up the pace eventually regardless of your playstyle. Once you get past this starting phase the pace is mostly dictated by your playstyle which brings us to the next point.
You can within reasonable bounds essentially play the game however as it's not a competition against others but rather just you playing at your own pace. Does this mean that this game has no community because it is an offline game ?
No that is not how it is at all, this game has a active community both on steam and discord and if you end up playing it I highly encourage you to join the discord server.

Back to the gameplay: You start out as the last survivor of the human race and go up against the local god on your planet which then escalates into you going around the universe and fighting every god you can find. Why do you do that ? Simple unlike the gods you are different in nature and capable of learning how to create things relating to them. Oh didn't I mention that every single god you beat will allow you to create something new ? Well they do.
You will also obtain God Power (GP) for beating them which is the main currency of the game and used to obtain stats which allow you to progress faster.
You start the game out with your own unique creation: Shadow Clones (SC). These allow you to progress faster and are what you will mostly use to progress within the game as they can fullfill tasks for you.
The first gameplay shift is introduced with rebirths. These function like they do in most other idle games. You restart your adventure but start with higher multipliers which are based on what you achieved in your previous rebirth.
All of this is accompanied by a story which is still progressing.

While playing you will slowly be introduced to new systems which there are too many of to mention/explain them all here.
One that absolutely is worth being mentioned though are pets.
You will slowly be gaining pets while progression towards your final goal of beating every single god there is. Some of these pets are exclusively unlocked via pet tokens which are obtainable through normal gameplay.
Now what do these pets do ?
Everything and some more. You can sent your pets to gather resources for you, train, multiply your stats (campaigns), do dungeons or boost yourself through other means.
Did I say dungeons ? Yes, yes I did.
Dungeons are seperate from most other progress in the game and allow you to assemble up to 4 teams (as of the moment of writing this) of up to 6 pets. Of course these pets also need some armor so you'll have to get some Blacksmiths and Alchemist to supply the Blacksmiths with materials. Oh right every single pet you obtain can be evolved to one of 8 classes which have unique functionalities and can either be specialised on doing campaigns, dungeons or in working on your gear for your pets as previously mentioned.

Once you beat the "final god" and as such gain the ability to create universes you will unlock challenges which are the bread and butter of just about any idle game. As of writing this there are a total of 34 different challenges (6 of which are day challenges that you can redo from time to time for better rewards.
These challenges will give you unique rewards and be progressively unlocked. If you have ever player any idle game at all you are most likely familiar with this concept.
There are 4 types of challenges one of which I have already mentioned. The remaining ones are normal challenges, multi reset challenges and GP reset challenges.
Normal challenges will give you a goal to reach with all of your stats (with one exception)
Multi reset challenges will not take away any of your stats (with a few small expceptions).
GP resets are the grand daddys of challenges that will take away a good part of your progress for the duration of the challenge (but give it back afterwards).

Other noteworthy things are that this game is still being developed but that it is also over 5 years old.
Is that a negative thing though ? That somewhat depends on what kind of player you are. If you want access to every part of the game fromt the get go then yes it is a negative thing as some of the things you can unlock will take months and even years to unlock. If you are sitting there now thinking to yourself: "But I can do that faster"; then I have to tell you: no. No matter how optimal you play some things will simply take time.

Now that I have mentioned "optimal" it is time to speak about the math side of this game. You can play this game casually without giving a second thought about things or you can try to minmax every last fraction of it which some people are constantly working on. You will do just fine doing whatever you want but if you want to go down the other route there are tools made available by players that will help you with that (refer to the steam community, the wiki or the discord sever).

Lastly one question that some of you might find interesting: Is this game P2W ?
Idle games or known to have a tendency to be P2W and I am not going to just say "well you can reach XYZ with enough" time.
I will also note that for the definition of P2W I will ignore that this game does not have any multiplayer aspects (apart from a chat option) and as such there is no real competition.
There are advantages within this game that you can get with money which I personally consider as P2W because they give you an advantage that you can't otherwise get or you would lose out on some form of progress. There are other options which will let you progress faster if you want to consider those as P2W in a single player.
So what do the ones that I consider P2W total out to ?
Option 1 would be the so called refrigerator which can be obtained during normal play but the discrepancy in time between when it starts to become useful to have and when you can actually unlock it is too big imo. The refrigerator costs 14.90€.
Option 2 is moreso targeted towards more advanced players and are called RTI slots. It is not really necessary to know what RTI means or does but the point here is that the ingame option to obtain there "sltos" requires you to sacrifice some of your progress while the money option skips this part. Each slot costs 4.90€ and you can buy up to 6. It should however be noted that by the time you can actually make use of these slots the amount of things you have to sacrifice are not as bad as it might sound at first. Regardless of that I consider this advantage unfair and as P2W.

Do these downsides make the game not enjoyable ? In my opinion not as those downsides are mostly based on if you want the benefit from them for yourself as you are not competing against anyone.
If you have read through this entire thing why not check the game and the community out ?

author: {'steamid': '76561197993171841', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 17587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17587, 'last_played': 1702893183}
review:
It's not very satisfying. It feels like a second job, despite me not resetting every hour for maximum efficiency but resetting every 10 to 12 hours.

Every time you progress to the next thing in this game, the next run becomes more work. Theres so many different mechanics from the getgo that increase your multipliers. And if you skip out on those you did the last run, your multipliers will go down. So everyrun I now have to train all skills to at least 10000 (which means some even higher to unlcok them all), have to build monuments, upgrade said monuments, craft a ton of different elements for the achievement multipliers, etc. This means my runs are longer and drawn out with quite some idle time in between, but since I cant automate it all I need to check back every 5 mins in the first hour or two before I can let it idle for a couple hours. 

Theres also too many things to setup at once at the start of each run. I got a couple hundred hours in this game and it left me completely exhausted, and I havent even defeated Baal. 

Disclaimer: I once played for about 200 hours, I came back recently and reset my progress, so this review is more based on around 80 hours of gameplay.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130254745', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 39661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16821, 'last_played': 1621420071}
review:
个人认为这是目前免费挂机游戏里的No.1 （至少是steam上的）, 全部挂机游戏中也能排到前三。

完全不用氪金就能有完整的体验，而且不氪金不会难受。

即使是对游戏困难度有要求的玩家都可以找到乐趣。

游戏寿命长，且找不到bug，更新稳定，还有限时活动。

宠物系统是亮点。

唯一的缺陷就是：前作ICE太烂，本作中有个特殊宠物需要解锁（可以用pet token来常规解锁，但这是超稀有资源），还好ICE基本上几十个小时就能满足解锁条件，且后期不需要频繁点击。

友情提示：本作和ICE都有完备的在线离线存档系统。且本作每日手工存档一下给一点零花的pet stone（我一开始真没注意到）

author: {'steamid': '76561197970996876', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 259489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2343, 'playtime_at_review': 66677, 'last_played': 1712453539}
review:
Good complex idle game, when I started I didn't think I would ever spend money on it, but I started playing more and more and decided I couldn't take it with me, so I was going to donate a little to the developer because I sure enjoy spending idle time here..  Anyway, if you like complex idle games that never have an end to them but something makes you want to work towards it anyway.

Edit:  Save server has issues quite a bit, lose time regularly with these issues.  Last loss was 6 hours, previously it was several days on multiple occasions.  Even though it can be fun, the save issues are frustrating.  You would think with this type of game, a better backup/save company that has redundancy would be used for customer save files.  Even now (1/18/21) the game is still losing progress and very frustrating.  Not sending any more money here.
developer_response:
If you lose progress it is best to save online before you close the game and make sure you are connected to the internet. 
The game also hints you to manually save the game every day. While usually the online save is enough, doing manual saves makes sure you have a backup if there is a server issue. If you do that, there shouldn't be any risk to lose any progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198289302583', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 73649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61250, 'last_played': 1630965287}

review: Played it for a while, early game is pretty good. But after defeating baal, the game becomes really slow. I got bored of it after that. I have thousands of hours in other idle games, idling is not the problem. Just not for me.
developer_response:

Here some guide about which challenges are best to be done when: https://c85.no/itrtg/guideline

author: {'steamid': '76561198078923958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 291727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14339, 'last_played': 1677425178}
review:
Игру не рекомендую, упала где то за год до донатной помойки.
Пациент представляет из себя очередной идл, с развитой системой прокачки. Правда всю эту систему портит частичное отсутствие логики, для меня.
В игре присутствует крайне подробно опысанный сюжет, и все победы твоего божка над прочими божками, крайне подробно описаны. Крайне подробно и скучно, очень напоминает аниме вроде насруто или хрыча-блича, с их крайне подробными боями и прочей чепухой. Много слов, мало дела.
В игре есть петы, которых ты хрен прокачаешь без доната, или хотя бы десятка ребиртов, а мб и больше.
В игре есть несколько десятков скиллов-мобов-построек, иссдедовать-мочить-строить которые ты заибешься, извиняюсь, но это придется делать. Иначе останешься слабаком.
В игре есть довольно паскудненькая графика, симпатичного визуала очень мало. Даже в идле по Забытым королевствам, изуродованные херои выглядят симпатичней.

Вообще, плюсов здесь, для меня, возможность пожечь время. Все в общем.
А минусы. 
1) Криво работающая автоматизация, автозакупка ресурсов и прочего. То все работает аккуратно, то генератов диванов не закупает ресурсы, а денег завались, клоны на работе есть.
2) Отсутствие логики в создании своей вселенной, особенно в начале. Когда ты способен заселить планету хер знает какую, людьми.... а планеты земного типа и вообще, создавать ещё не способен. И подобное.
3) Донат, запросто способный склонить баланс в пользу игрока, влияет на все и весьма серьезно. Можно и без доната конечно, как я с другом играю, но донат позволяет все сделать охренеть как быстрее и лучше.

Поиграть можно, но рекомендовать не стану.
06.01.23 К Новому Гаду игра превратилась в донатную помойку по сути. 
Петы стали очень дороже, 300 к итемов вместо 200 к кстати, или это тем кто давно играет подарок.
Упали добычи пет стонов(меняются на петов) Мои зверюшки явно не слабже прошлой партии, но носят 338 стонов за раз, было в прошлой партии более тысячи.
Евенты скатились в донат, позволяя купить имбо вещи за 5 к итемов..... при 120 итемах за заход, и вроде 300+ за логин ежедневный, не уверен что возможно нормальными путями купить имбушки.
В общем очень сильно больше доната, снижения уровня прогрессии, да и обновления игру не то чтобы особенно расширяют.

Если я нуб, ну как бы нуб, и не знаю шо пишу, с интересом послушаю как оно на самом деле есть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030006280', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1600460477}
review: Very much on the 'idle" side of idle game.  It has multiple progression mechanics, but goes light on the mechanics.  My interest disappeared when the "newbie bonus" turned off and I had no meaningful choices to make for 4 hours.  If you are someone like me who prefers more goal oriented progression games, then I'd give this one a pass.
developer_response:
If you stopped after the newbie buff was out, you stopped playing before you unlocked 95% of the things. The more active you play the faster you are usually and it has lots of meaningful choices or goals. If you had no meaningful choices for 4 hours you probably didn't do something optimally. Depending on how you play you might progress 10-20 times faster than if you play only casually.

You might want to look at the wiki to help you progress faster: https://itrtg.fandom.com/wiki/Idling_to_Rule_the_Gods_Wiki
Or join the discord for help from advanced players: https://discord.gg/r2u6VNU

author: {'steamid': '76561198054749776', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1600199767}
review: Ad shop that only works on android so can't get any buffs since I don't own an android. Layout of the game is pretty odd. If you want to change how your default character looks, you have to wait a long while, or throw out money for just something that's visual for all I know. Some things could be a lot simpler as well, don't wanna go into details since I already uninstalled, but it's way less interesting than other idle games I've played.
developer_response:
The ads are only a small boost and not needed by any means. Steam has no ads available I could show, but you can get them from android or kongregate and connect saves without loss.

The looks of the character is not really a big part of the game but easy to get for free if you play long enough. But well it is an idle game so expecting things fast won't work here. The game has a lot of content and different things to unlock but it takes time and effort to unlock.

The beginning might be a bit hard to understand and it is not an easy game to progress easily everything but most players who play it for longer have fun with it. 

Because there is more fun if you know what to do and what you can optimize it is best to join discord where people can give lots of info and advanced strategies about how to progress faster: https://discord.gg/r2u6VNU

author: {'steamid': '76561198406157991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 99751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2559, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1712435733}
review: While I vehemently oppose the addictive nature of idle games, this game has its charm to keep it interesting in the long run. Having started this game in 2014, I'm very surprised that to this day the game has interesting, material updates. The community is active and the creator is very responsive to player requests. The evolving complexity of the pet system, along with the challenges, makes it diverse enough of an idle game for it to feel like more than just staring at a screen.

review:
游戏是个很不错的放置游戏，内容不错，而且资源占用很低，优化做的很好，这点要赞一个。
略微难受的有两个地方，第一是进度偏慢，不适合急性子，想玩通关那真就是按年算了，另外一个就是没有中文啊。。。特么求中文啊。。。我要给朋友安利都难啊。。。。
其他倒是没啥，前几次R基本把SHADOW的CAP刷满之后就开始慢慢挂了，尤其在解锁PET之后挂CAMPAIGNS之后，那更是每次R都要花很长时间刷PET成长，基本来说这就是个刷时间的游戏。

review:
Ein wahres Idle-Spiel, es gibt viel zu tun, viel zu erreichen. Nach etlichen Stunden Spielzeit habe ich einen Bruchteil vom Möglichen erreicht, ich spiele mit Sicherheit nicht hocheffizient, das ist aber in diesem Spiel kein Nachteil.
Immer wieder kommen Updates heraus, was es langfristig noch interessanter macht.
Es gibt einen Ingame-Shop, in dem sich Ungeduldige und solche, welche den Entwickler unterstützen wollen, Vereinfachungen/Zeitersparnisse und Namens/Geschlechtsänderungen etc. kaufen kann.

review:
Solid game. Interesting mechanics. Has a lot of features. FREE. Lasts for month of (non) playing (well you just clic to do a few things but as it's an idle game you don't really play). Relatively frequently updated and being worked on.
First game I got from Steam (or second, not sure if I got tap tap infinity first), first pure idle game i've ever played and one of the best (if not THE best) and not disappointed once.
Would definitely recommand it. Just try it, it's light to install, it doesn't take a lot of ressources, you enjoy it and like or just uninstall, no big deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977206728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 67206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66873, 'last_played': 1609197456}
review:
One of the best free incremental games I've ever played, and I've played most of them.  It's got a ton of depth, and I'm nowhere close to finishing it.  

 It's confusing at first and doesn't hold your hand, but part of the fun is figuring out how the game itself works.  I don't think I would find this as fun as I do without being interested in game design, because I can see it being really frustrating and easy to get stuck on, but hey -- you're risking zero dollars to try, so give it a shot maybe?

review:
At current stage I cannot recommend. The interface and user experience is not good and there are many of buttons, icons and features positions which could be improved by redesigning visuals.

The developer should take UI UX course and organize your game more friendly. There are plenty cheap UI UX courses on Udemy, some lessons are free on YouTube.  Getting through those courses will give some ideas on what should be done and what not.

No excuse for improving the messy interface.

review: Despite its UI flaws, ITRTG broke interesting ground in design and caused me to revise my perspective on "idle" games. It's instructive as a study in the progressive introduction of mechanics, player acquisition of system mastery, and the provision of feedback/responses to that mastery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198958581038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 150218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12055, 'last_played': 1623786811}
review: Such an addicting game with an amazing story line. I've played countless other idle games but always come back to this one as it's my favorite. The concept and execution is flawless. I originally played it a few years ago on Kongregrate and started up again recently since I have a lot of time on my hands due to COVID-19. I gotta say, it's addicting as ever and I'm finally about to defeat Baal (which I know is only scratching the surface since there's so much more left to do). As a fellow writer, I am inspired by the story and fight scenes that it describes and would love to work on helping to finish the story if it were possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183351507', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 27815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6424, 'last_played': 1609457291}
review: I played Idling to Rule The Gods on Kongregate years ago and really liked the game but it was heavy going back then, lots of drudging and waiting.  When I rediscovered it on Steam I was pleasantly surprised.  Instead of feeling like you were going nowhere there were plenty of things to do.  Also the awarding of God Power is more balanced which helps keep the game moving.  I really like this game and I'm glad I found it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991650038', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 112341, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52764, 'last_played': 1607015333}
review:
The creation tab is broken, it will occasionally skip some next at numbers. When offline it will either not create anything or create stones, making 0 progress offline. The training tabs are also ridiculous, there is no way to decrease the clone cap for each activity unless you spend multiple days fighting, with no indication of which fighting ability corresponds to which training activity. Even if it does, the current estimates is taking 50-60 INGAME days to one cap the bottom most training activity. The game does not consider offline idling times, and only times when the game is running. 

This is by someone who came back after not touching this game for 2 years, literally 0 progress made in offline mode. Which is kinda breaks one part of the idling game. So in general I would not recommend since many people care about this aspect. That being said being "active" in this idle game is very rewarding with numerous systems and gameplay loop but that's it, it's  pretentious that the game thinks it's alright to keep open 24/7 instead of being able to close and reopen every couple of hours/days to manage to make any real progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013924266', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1587079313}
review:
Oh boy. So I've never been a incremental game kind of guy. But after updating my mac to catalina without realizing the horrible consequences it would have on my beloved 32 bit games, I have been stuck wading through a short list of actually playable games I would of never played unless this happened. ITRTG is one of them. Now I've played a few idle games before, and quickly gotten super bored with them after less than an hour. Actually the same thing happened with ITRTG. But instead of quitting the game, I just put on afk mode and left it go for a couple hours. 

I came back to complete addiction.

This one is a slow starter, but holy heck, once you rebirth once and figure out a bit of the obtuse interface, it sinks its claws into your chest and won't let go.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987481731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1228075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214710, 'last_played': 1676123088}
review: Yes I recommend it and even with all those hours I still feel like there's so much to learn.  I first picked this up on my phone and started playing it but now I've migrated to computer and the hours really started wracking up.  I have a strict policy that I don't spend money on free games from the play store but, as I started to understand how things work, I have purchased a few key things that make the game so much better.  It's really not a money grab, it's more about convenience and time savings.  Pets are still the "not yet fully understood" entity but they are relatively easy to get and you don't "have" to spend a dime on them.  Currently at 23 pets without having done so. I don't mean to harp on IAP's as I honestly feel developers deserve to make money for their products and especially for quality games like this one.  So if you're thinking you'd like a game that you don't have to spend hours face to face with but that you can still feel and see accomplishment, this is a great choice.  You come back in the morning and see how the plans you set in motion the evening before have worked out and get a real sense of progress. Then if you didn't make the progress you expected, regroup and try something new the next time and see what that get's you.  It is a slow burn kind of game and if that's something you've enjoyed in the past, give ITRTG a try.

review:
A decent idle game with interesting mechanics and challenges. It has a good 'rebirth' system that helps you progress further in the game. The game receives regular updates and new additions. It has certainly been an inspiration for other games in the genre.

Start small, work your way up to become a god-slayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053109137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 416523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263645, 'last_played': 1647443403}
review:
So far 180 days (4393hrs) or so in, I must say it's a hard/slow progress but one of the best  "idle" games you will find. 

The game isn't so Idle as it may look and I of many players play this "idle" game as an active one.
(game runs almost 24/7 in the background if not the fore ground)

There is no real losing but to win it takes allot of investment.

Some players are up to over 2000 days and they still have tasks they are striving to achieve, let alone the Dev adding more stuff on a regular basis and events.

all in all a solid 10/10 for ITRTG if you ask me.

review: Not for those that lack imagination. This deceivingly simplistic game offers thousand of hours of varying game play that even at 123 hours of play I have not fully unlocked. The tool tips are life savers and despite their abundance could actually do to be more detailed. While the art style is severely lacking reminding one of graphics from the early 2000's this game is a great time sink and I  recommend it to anyone that loves idle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198254466642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6983, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1088, 'last_played': 1705506719}
review:
This game is one of my favourite idling games, at the moment. (Btw, I have played this game for more than what it says up top, I have played on mobile and I had over 100 hours on a different steam account)

I will admit, it looks intimidating at first, and it does not have the most inviting user interface to new players. However, despite this, if you learn and grow accustomed to it, there is never-ending content waiting for you. The game, from what I have heard from the discord, can take a few months to *complete* (as I said, there is never-ending content, so there is plenty to do).

If you ever need help with where you are/are stuck then join the ITRTG discord and just ask. I can guarantee you that somebody will have your solution, as lots of the players in it are veterans of the game (with a share of new people too). 

The only thing I could say is that the UI could be improved. The developer is aware of this and has made efforts to improve it, which says a lot about them. 

It also has pretty sweet pop culture references (The Great FSM, Fullmetal Alchemist, and Dragon Ball) just to name a few! As well as references to countless religions from around the globe, without poking fun at any of them. 

9/10, would recommend to anyone that likes idling games and can be patient in waiting for great rewards. A gem of games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045642235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 54044, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42555, 'last_played': 1707450173}
review:
It's a free idle game, and it has many checkpoints. Interaction is encouraged to happen in bursts after the initial startup. There's very little to compel a player to sit with the game open for long periods of time or frequently interact to optimize gains. On top of that, there's a story to read to put things into context and additional challenges to pursue as long-term goals.

It's an okay time-killer that I would be content to recommend. At the least, it's not something to avoid.

review: Highly recommended .  Yes it's an idle game, it's going to go slow at first,  Lots of different stuff to do, challenges, pets, several different ways to play.  This is the only idle game that has managed to hold my interest for more than a couple days at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992686253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 442535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264167, 'last_played': 1598946858}
review:
I have played a lot of idle and clicker games and this is the best I have found. If you are fan of idling games and you don't need to get everything right away, I recommend this game.

I have played about 4000h when making this review and there is still a lots and lots to do. The start might seem overwhelming at first, but you will learn the basics in reasonable time. Community is nice and you can get help in forums and discord if you need it, although, there are help files in the game and a good wiki to help you at the start.

Game is free to play and you don't need to buy anything, if you don't want to.

review:
It's an idle game like the title says.
You are a god/godess and must improve your power to beat other god/godess.
There are a whole lotta skills to improve, things to build and fight to have.
It's surprisingly deep for an idle game.
Me like it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198017482278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 385655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4908, 'playtime_at_review': 195327, 'last_played': 1712441443}
review: One of the deepest idling games I've ever played.  The community on discord is pretty great with good representation from around the world.  You beat the game the first time through, and then realize that it was actually a lengthy tutorial.  You could spend years unlocking everything here.  It's a solid run in the backgrounds game with a very active developer, who also hangs out in the chat.  You can get everything in the game for free, with some p2w options to speed certain things up.
