author: {'steamid': '76561198285900067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1056676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 969, 'playtime_at_review': 434127, 'last_played': 1712451483}
review:
Idle games are oddly addictive. This one has a very active developer. He's been at it for years, and has a long history of listening to the community. The game as it is now is the result of that cooperative relationship. It is complex and rewarding. If it seems slow at first, just let it go and come back to it later. Click around. Figure stuff out, or read the guides. There's no wrong way to play. 

It's free, so seriously, give it a chance. See if it grows on you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041202350', 'num_games_owned': 677, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 615612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2180, 'playtime_at_review': 54094, 'last_played': 1712455215}
review:
방치형 게임 좋아하면 ㄹㅇ 갓갓겜 꼭하셈

환생 시스템이랑 그걸 통한 챌린지 시스템이 정말 잘 짜여져 있음. 과정 자체도 다양하고 보상도 만족스러워서 계속 플레이 하게끔 만듦.

도전과제처럼 특정 조건을 만족하면 펫을 언락 할 수 있는데 그 자체에서 느낄 수 있는 재미도 있지만 펫이 게임에서 활용도가 매우 높아서 확실한 목표가 되어주고 그만큼의 가치를 함.

할것도 많고 그 하나하나 컨텐츠가 다 잘 짜여져 있어서 정말 오래해도 질리지 않고 재미있는 게임

author: {'steamid': '76561198230838048', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 478289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93175, 'last_played': 1706085325}
review:
这篇文章测评有些过时啦，想交流的玩家加群探讨吧~ 群：865965429 

挂挂玩玩这个游戏快半年了，1600多小时，这个游戏可以说是click游戏里面非常耐玩的了！
强烈推荐给闲着没事的复读机们！
英文其实很简单，仔细看一下都懂
简单说一下游戏流程

1.界面概况
进入游戏先看左上角clones，代表你的克隆体数量，它会默认不停地自动制造（划重点），最开始你的上限只有1000个，每当你制造20个克隆体、或有20个克隆体被杀死时，你的上限就会加1（这种方法的上限为100000）。再想增加上限，就需要花费GP点数买了。游戏中完成绝大多数的工作都要靠它们驻扎~~而且最重要的是，无论你要完成任何任务，或者任何奇怪的终极挑战，你的clones上限永远不会下降（即使有些终极挑战下降也是临时的）。

最左上Power level：代表着你的战力，在挑战boss时，可直观对比体现是否能打过。
左下六项数据除Divinity外共同决定了你的Power level。其中消耗Divinity（神性）可以建造建筑或制造水晶，消耗Creating（制造）可创造毒星球（UB2用）。

Stats右边Rebirth：就是重生，点击底下的Rebirth后，你的power level和六项全部清零，但你会获得乘积倍数，以便在重生后更快的提高各项能力，当四项都变成绿色就可以更好地重生了，不过考虑到效率，初始游戏者建议四项倍数全部>10再进行重生。

Info：关游戏时候Save和Save Online都点一下，以防意外发生。

旁边的challange：完成挑战可获得丰厚的奖励，不过有一些非常难完成的挑战，也是这个游戏最费时间的地方，游戏中期才可以进行挑战，比较耗时。

Clones旁边小豆：点击查看God Power(GP)，整个游戏中最最有用的东西，几乎一切重要的东西都是靠GP换来的~购买Clones上限，增加建造速度，创造速度等等。游戏初期很难获得，但随着游戏时间的累计，人物的强大，后每天能得到上百个。

小豆旁边的红包：红包代表有奖励可领，拉下至lucky draws领取，每22h免费可领一个，领过后付费项目有折扣

这个游戏充钱不会有很大的提高，特别是游戏初期，不过非要充钱的话，还是有几个花少量的钱但能有较大提升的地方的。
（1）游戏中期开始，需要更多的水晶槽和水晶的等级，尤其是水晶槽，买过后会有质的飞跃，有的水晶会产GP。。。

2.游戏初期
（1）首先Train里面的Physical和skills，让clones驻扎进行训练，前一项够高（达到500.1000.1500.2000...以此类推）解锁下一项，注意将右边的Sync打开，可以实现二者同步训练。持续让clones驻扎在这个训练，能力则持续提升，右边CAP点击后驻扎当前clones最大效率。
（2）fight里的monster同样，需要clones驻扎，打败一个就可解锁下一个。同样地，持续让clones驻扎在这个怪物堆里，能力则持续提升，但clones在你战力低于怪物的时候会死，因此前期可以用怪物杀死你的克隆体增加其软上限。旁边的gods要按顺序打，打败一个会增加你重生后的乘积，而且会解锁build里面的各种物品（从造一滴水一点空气到造出一个宇宙），在其界面更改（默认是不停地造clones）。Build里面的creat以及upgrade，打败特定boss后，可看到，解锁建造各种纪念碑及升级的能力，让克隆体驻扎，消耗各种材料，建造/升级完毕后，增加你的各项能力。
（3）build、Train和fight都有各种小成就，完成将会增加乘积倍数，为下次重生加倍。
（4）上面说过打倒一些特殊的神后解锁monument（建筑）以及其升级功能，建造以增加自己的各项能力，其中ToG建造解锁神性制造机器，点击fill可将神性放上去，产出更多的神性，下面三项capacity，DG和CS分别和增加容量，转化率和速度，可驻扎clones对其升级。
（5）最右边planet，建议直至重生后能打败所有gods后再进行。
此为初期阶段流程。

author: {'steamid': '76561198130078951', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 713271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617140, 'last_played': 1646161029}
review:
I suppose after playing for a minute or two I should write a review. ITRTG isn't a clicker game because I generally hate clickers. It's a true idle game. If you ever wanted a hobby that could pass the few mundane minutes before work or until the kids get home etc, then this is the game you've been looking for. It's not a fast paced 'rite nao' game so don't go into it thinking you're going to speed through to endgame content. Everything in the game takes time, even if you spend money. Unless you're planning to spend copious amounts of money and then my question to you would have to be, 'where did you go so wrong in life that you're willing to spend that much to "win" an idle game?' That being said I'm not saying don't support the developer by refusing to spend any money at all either.

I've left the game a couple times for up to a year at one point. Every time I have left there's always a ton of new content and challenges when I get back. The developer has done a lot of work to the game and he doesn't seem content to just quit here. There's constant updates-both good and bad-but the bad usually gets fixed and the good definitely outweighs it. It's a game that you don't have to spend a lot of time on to get things rolling. 10-15 minutes here or there and you could be set for hours, or days depending on what you're doing.

Despite a positive review the game isn't for everyone. If you don't want to keep the game open in the background 24/7 you aren't going to get ahead as fast as someone who is. Online time really matters as there are quite a few things that will not happen while you are offline. Now early on this isn't a problem as really there's only one thing in the beginning that won't track offline. Later on though you will miss out on 'god power' (ingame currency) from different sources if you're offline for too long at a time.

I cannot stress this enough: Do not play this game if you can not be patient. There's a ton of wikis and guides out there. Both on Kongregate's forum and Steam's so spend some of that idle game time looking up guides and wikis and learning as much as you can. Don't just enter the chat or discord and ask a question that's covered in the ingame FAQ or the fan wikis.. it's annoying. We're more than happy to help but give a man a fish...etc. Also, it's an idle game so don't enter the ingame chat and spam 'hello' 3-4 times and then leave within 30 seconds. Most of us just lurk there all day. Sometimes conversations happen over the course of 6 hours, we're used to someone coming in 4 hours after a conversation and making a casual comment about it. It takes a special kind of person to idle... and idle chat. It's not that we're not helpful, we just may not be helpful RIGHT NOW because we're not there. I hear the Discord guys are more active so you can always go that route, most of us in the ingame chat are just too lazy to bother switching over, we're the holdouts.

In all seriousness though, if you like slow grinding strategy type games... MUDs for instance. Then give this a chance, it's not the same but it's the closest thing I can think of to a mostly text based slow paced game. There's really nothing else quite like it that I've found. I hope to see you all there and as I always say, "Happy Idling."

author: {'steamid': '76561198140741469', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2116, 'last_played': 1568378769}
review:
A good idle game with complex yet easy-to-learn mechanics.

One thing I'm having issue though, is its save system... I lost about 5 offline progression, with 3 of them in a row (worth a some 30+ hours of game progress) and its quite disheartening when you enter a game and the first thing that comes to mind is "PLEASE DON'T FAIL THE LOAD AGAIN". I always do an online save and offline save when I quit the game and I'm starting to get annoyed of being stagnant in this game.

Please address this issue, otherwise, game is great, but still not for everyone I guess.

The biggest plus:

author: {'steamid': '76561197991905001', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2799381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1327744, 'last_played': 1653644583}
review:
In my view, the best and deepest idle game around. Don't let the programmer graphics put you off! The developer is still adding new content to this day (August 2019) and taking the game in new and interesting directions. It'll suit pretty much every type of play style, from highly active to (almost) completely passive. 

A very active Discord channel and an excellent wiki make getting to grips with the game simple. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024969911', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 226, 'playtime_forever': 1888859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327075, 'last_played': 1692466036}
review:
I endorse this one. It has a lot of things I set and forget until I am ready to rebirth, so I play it as a pure idler game rather than a clicker or a fiddler (but if you are the fiddling type, speedruns and such will progress faster). 

One note: Take the hours played with a huge shakers worth of salt -- you progress faster if you leave the game running in the background instead of quitting and returning, so the hours metric is "how many hours was it running in the background" not "how much time was spent actively engaged it it. 

Note there are several guides on the Kongregate forum for various aspects of gameplay.

Microtransactions are available and useful but not critical. I suggest buying the refrigerator as the free unlock for that one is painful. The daily packs are a good purchase for new players

author: {'steamid': '76561198269154013', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 89987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86511, 'last_played': 1661084032}

A complex idle game that breaks your mind.
This is a progressive type game, unlocking stuff later on to get used to the base mechanics.
If you like a number getting so big it takes you over a minute to count the zeros of, then play this. Good luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198424125328', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1561805012}
review:
适合挂机的游戏，不需要太多的操作。
试玩了一下：
1。一开始需要train/Physical，第一项是running，一开始的点数是一千，练跑步到一千多点的时候会解锁第二项Physical-sits up, 练习体能会增加主角的HP，攻击与体能，练了一会后可以训练skills，skills会增加mystic。
2. 都练得差不多了，可以fight了，fight一开始是monster，第一个是slimy，就像炉石的软泥怪类似，然后再慢慢解锁，fight monster 可以增加battle 也就是战斗技巧，和divinity 也就是神性，我猜想打第一个GOD，就是需要神性。
3. 打完第一个god,就可以rebirth 重生了，估计会提高很多。

大概是这样，我也刚开始玩，游戏设定还是很有趣的，花钱应该会很快提高，不花钱就放着挂机吧！

author: {'steamid': '76561197991288666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 578179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115948, 'last_played': 1678585432}
review: Right now, this is the best long-term engaging idle game on Steam. It's not a clicker game, which I like a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052434134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1607526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8074, 'playtime_at_review': 606473, 'last_played': 1712451277}
review:
This game manages to escape the bland "cookie clicker"- formula of "bash left mouse button, buy building, repeat until you reset" by using different mechanics (assigning clones to training and fighting monster) and giving you multiple permanent ways to become stronger (god power upgrades, might, pets to name a few). This successfull new formula inspired many other good idle games (NGU [not on Steam], WAMI https://store.steampowered.com/app/1011510) which is an indicator for its success.

The developer still works to improve and add new mechanics to the game after 5 years (which includes the time it was Kongregate exclusive), so you won't run out of content to play anytime soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054332989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1472935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14530, 'playtime_at_review': 962295, 'last_played': 1712352894}
review:
Take into account the amount of time played by most negative reviews (Not Much). For an idle game this game is fairly complex and it has a LOT going on,it can be overwhelming until you get the hang of new aspects. And perhaps even it may seem a bit slow in the beginning. But as someone who has played it fanatically for over 3 years now i can assure you this game has a LOT to offer as it definitely speeds up,and i myself was overwhelmed at points,but i overcame it and have only thrived in doing so.  This is absolutely my favorite game. 

It receives updates regularly,and the Discord is friendly and helpful with the Dev himself who interacts often.  Perhaps the game may not be for you..like i said,it's complex and has a lot of depth,not everyone is equipped for things that may require a brain now and then. But with that said,i would never consider it a difficult game. There's no wrong way to play really. It's just progression,and time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133288288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 25231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 116, 'last_played': 1636010260}
review:
My absolute favorite of the idle game universe. I played a lot of these kind of games (mainly because I'm lazy) and I can tell that this is a really well made game. 

Of course, it IS an idle game so you shouldn't expect much gameplay wise. It's pretty much just clicking on different things and looking forward to "revive" to be much stronger then before.

But this game know how to give you this feeling of becoming overpowered and even has a REALLY cool story line. 

In the game you will be fighting different monsters and your ability is to clone yourself. You clones, similar to the anime series "naruto", will make it so that everything they do will upgrade you in a certain way. So you can for example use 100 clones to fight rats. Just normal rats. Through that you will upgrade different abilities and will reach a point where you can defeat the first god of the planet. This will give you a new ability. A secondary ability of yours is that each time you revive you basically reset the time for everyone else except for you. So you lost your levels and everything but kept the new skills and clone cap (you will know what I mean if you play the game) and by that you can level up again MUCH faster and get to defeat new bosses.

As I said, your clones will be fighting rats at the start and struggle. This is because your clones are actually much weaker then you but if they die you won't even get hurt in the slightest. 

I obviously can't tell every detail of the storyline but the developer thought of something really intruging and fun-to-read so if you are interested in a nice idle rpg with storyline and a "feel like you become an op god that rules the universe" feeling this game is for you

author: {'steamid': '76561198049261848', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 125287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5135, 'last_played': 1708393748}
review:
Good idle free-to-play game. It seems like a single person has developed this? I could be wrong, but if so this is fairly impressive.

Pros: This game will last you a long while if you stick with it... a long while. I've put so many "hours" (much of it was offline) into this game without much effort at all and I still have tons of content to unlock. The general concept is great and the feeling of becoming incredibly powerful is quite satisfying. Nothing quite like kicking godly a$$ and creating worlds... or galaxies... or universes. There's even a story of your journey to read while you "train".

Cons (these may be more just personal preferences): Though the general concept is great, some of the finer details are lacking for me.  The logic behind creation/training tends to get a little funny in certain areas; I realize this is likely due to gameplay balancing but it still makes me twitch if I think about it too much. The pantheon of gods are all over the place... Nordic, Japanese, Roman, and Greek (and possibly other) myths and gods all intermix in a somewhat strange fashion to my mind. The story, though a very nice touch, could use a good editor and if the art was cleaned up a bit it would go a long way.

Overall, it's a good idle game that if cleaned up a bit more could potentially be huge.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299313081', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1293, 'last_played': 1545328901}
review:
Review: Idling to Rule the Gods for the PC.

Idling to Rule the Gods is the poorly-anticipated new game from a Indie publisher you've never heard of, but is it any good? 

Screw the establishment, man! Oversized publishers that don't move with the times are so old hat. The cool way to publish games is to be a lean operation of a couple of guys who haven't been able to afford a YCMA shower in a week who release games like Idling to Rule the Gods for free and grow beards and hang out at coffee shops and have documentaries made about them.

It is basically idle/clicker games version of the weird kid that nobody likes in school. Idling to Rule the Gods tries to seperate itself from the pack with no new features.

There are a bevy of upgrades to buy through the game's obnoxious in app purchasing system, but players will find that they can safely get through some of the game without outlaying further cash. 

It's too slow-paced, even for an idle game. The graphics are pretty crap! You'll be checking if something's wrong with your system, and maybe some people will get a kick out of the poorly executed Anime art style, but it's not enough. Being a 2D game, the hardware capabilities of your PC aren't exactly being pushed to the limit. The animation-quality visuals are a cliche-filled torrent of junk which I think is OK if you're into that sort of thing..

Given enough time and money, Idling to Rule the Gods could really be something less terrible. However as it stands right now it's just too unpolished and boring to recommend to anyone.

Overall Score: 2 / 10

Review by Alexis/Poke

author: {'steamid': '76561198116879965', 'num_games_owned': 1283, 'num_reviews': 6897, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1681196088}
review:
Idling to Rule the Gods-это бесплатная игра с большим количеством контента и некоторыми мини-играми.

В зависимости от вашего стиля игры, вы можете играть быстро или медленно. В любом случае это может быть весело в течение сотен часов!


В 9001 году люди уничтожили все обитаемые планеты в известной вселенной. На последней планете им удалось создать устройство космического измерения. С помощью этого устройства они смогли переместиться в другое измерение. Мир безделья, чтобы править богами.
На первой обитаемой планете, которую они нашли, они заметили, что мир работает иначе, чем известная вселенная. Им правят боги. Вскоре после этого Гиперион, первый Бог, нашел людей и сразился с ними. После продолжительного боя все люди, кроме тебя – игрока – погибли. Выживая все это время, вы развили свою собственную особую способность: создавать теневых клонов.

Игра начинается здесь.
Вы создаете теневых клонов, они тренируются, изучают навыки и сражаются с монстрами для вас, в то время как вы поглощаете их силу, пока вы не будете достаточно сильны, чтобы победить первого бога “Гипериона”. После победы над Гиперионом, вы найдете много, гораздо более сильных богов. Чтобы победить их всех, вы должны найти различные способы стать более могущественными. Вы возрождаетесь, создаете свои собственные памятники, тренируете домашних животных и сражаетесь с высшими существами.

10 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197992888740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2156967, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20091, 'playtime_at_review': 14699, 'last_played': 1712454716}
review:
＿人人人人人人＿
＞　神と戦え　＜
￣Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^￣

限界を越えろ。
極限を越えた戦いがここにはある。

数千、数万の兵力を率いろ！
己を鍛え上げ、神々に挑め！
最強の神となり究極の果てを目指せ！


そんなこと書いてますが。これほぼ数値眺めてインフレしていく放置ゲームです。
別のゲームやってる間に起動して徐々に強くしていくそんな感じです。

※追加レビュー※
バージョンも変わってちょくちょく色々追加されたので追加レビュー。
やりごたえのあるチャレンジ（ご丁寧にSteam実績対応）も数多く存在し、それぞれのチャレンジを複数回挑戦する大きなメリットまであり、チャレンジに挑み続けることが育成の指針になりうるゲームでもあります。
最初の目的であるBaalを倒して戦いのチュートリアルがスタート。より強いBaalに挑むも良し（それもメリット有ります）、一旦チャレンジに挑んで新たな力を得るも良し。とりあえず脳死でGodPower稼いで色々増やしてから考えるもひとまずヨシ！
やることは結局……。

＿人人人人人人＿
＞　神と戦え　＜
￣Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^￣

※アワードのために

バージョンアップで増えるチャレンジや新要素。やることにパワーアップが追い付かない。
ペット関係が特に無尽蔵の育成要素を感じます。
無限に遊べます。無限に成長できます。

とりあえず、とにかく。

＿人人人人人人＿
＞　神と戦え　＜
￣Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^Y^￣

author: {'steamid': '76561198088466922', 'num_games_owned': 1253, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1534793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8900, 'playtime_at_review': 172581, 'last_played': 1712452808}
review:
Es ist ein sehr interessantes Idle Game mit vielen inreressanten Features. Es ist ein eher untypisches Idle Game, was relativ schwer mit den meisten anderen Idle Games zu vergleichen ist. Und nein, es ist kein Klicker.
Die einzigen größeren Schwächen sind, dass es ein sehr langsames Spiel ist, was aber nicht ganz ungewöhnlich für ein Idle game ist, und, dass man einige der Challenges relativ oft wiederholen muss und sie nach einigerzeit etwas eintönig sind.

Außerdem hat das Spiel eine sehr schön geschriebene Story. Allerdings ist sie noch nicht fertig und es wird nur alle paar Monate ein neues Kapitel veröffentlicht, aber das Warten ist es wert.

Und da der Entwickler noch aktiv an dem Spiel arbeitet wird es auch noch einige neue Features geben.

review:
Suprisingly long-lived idle game. Plenty of stuff to do, and the developer continues to update.
Doesn't require a lot of active time - I normally spend about 5 mins a day resetting everything. But can easily spend a couple of hours if need to pass some time.
Doesn't push you to spend real money either.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963164433', 'num_games_owned': 286, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 458878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51637, 'last_played': 1645383923}
review:
Das Beste IDLE Game das ich kenne und das einzige bei dem ich seit über einem Jahr aktiv dabei bleibe.
Gemeinsamer online Speicher und Sync mit Steam, der Handy-App und der Browserversion sodass man immer und jederzeit mal kurz reinschaun kann über welchen Zugang auch immer. 
Das größte Plus sind die Challenges welche einen viel Abwechslung und Anreiz bieten.
Und auch nach zwei Jahren gibt es noch Support mit regemäßige Updates, neue Challenges, neue Pets, neue Story parts sowie Events.

Ich kann es jedem der IDLE games gerne Spielt nur empfehlen!

author: {'steamid': '76561197960277861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1546143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8994, 'playtime_at_review': 271074, 'last_played': 1712455096}
review:
This is probably going to be my only idle game. There is enough to do to keep me occupied for the next 5 years (give or take), and there is no demand that I spend money to reduce that time (though you can). The developer also adds and modifies the game fairly regularly (pet campaigns was a huge change)

If you're looking to kill time, and enjoy min-maxing, this is worth a look. If you aren't looking for something that is just an interface with bars that fill up faster the more you play, I'd look elsewhere.

Well, the game is amazing. No doubts about it. But I've encountered a glitch. My laptop was on Flight mode and I clicked to buy the one time offer of one pet token for $4.95 or however much it is. My display for the Kong tab now just comes up with the text "Waiting for the result... Please make sure the Steam overlay is activated."
Could I please have some insight on how to fix this? As I currently am unable to claim my daily lucky draw.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297692433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2481, 'last_played': 1657472064}
review: This is a very good game with a story that keeps expanding, It is not just consistent repeats. There are new skills, new pets, new bosses. The characters in the story are likable, even lovable. Even the gods that you are against in the game grow to be more exciting and engaging characters. The downside is the AFK. Sometimes you need to do stuff. Also add items or weapons. Add a new story. I had a dream today where I met some of the characters from that universe. This game is very good and it draws me in with the exciting gameplay. Character customization needs to be improved though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083578919', 'num_games_owned': 1725, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 3369634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20011, 'playtime_at_review': 301720, 'last_played': 1712454970}
review:
Gave up a bit the first time I played this because it seemed a bit too much.

Gave it a real chance the second time and got really into it. So many things to do. You have to spend some time to get used to it, read wiki, ask people in chat / discord for advise, but imo, worth sinking some time into, and does not suffer from all the same repetitiveness as many or most in the idle / clicker genre.

Overall a great game. 0/5.

(Edit: Its still ok game, has pet dungeons and stuff now)

author: {'steamid': '76561198138535845', 'num_games_owned': 2256, 'num_reviews': 389, 'playtime_forever': 19123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4357, 'last_played': 1660176910}
review:
[spoiler]Отвратительный кликер. Собственно говоря, это и не кликер даже. С первой минуты игры начал плеваться от него. Растянулся этот мазахизм на три месяца и 72 часа суммарно по паре заходов в день на 10-15 минут. [/spoiler]
[b]Собственно, раз уж я столько отстрадался, наверное стоит написать общую суть кликера, тем более что все на английском, всего всего много много, а по русски толком ничего не написано. Собственно, у вас есть бог(иня) и вам нужно развивать его(ее) мощь. Сначала создаются ваши клоны до лимита (изначально 1000). Вкладываем их в тренировки, параллельно качаются скиллы. Пытаемся сражаться с монстрами. Когда нужно мало клонов для капа (необходимое количество, идеально 1) сражения с ними, переходим к следующему. Параллельно сражаемся с другими божествами. По мере победы над ними открываются новые творения, которые нужно начать создавать, и дальше они будут создаваться автоматически. Чем больше всего этого качается, убивается и создается, тем вы мощнее. Когда прогресса больше особо не видно, перерождаемся слева во вкладке Rebirth (зеленые цифры означаются что вы станете мощнее, чем были во время предыдущего перерождения) и начинаем все сначала. Со временем вы победите определенное божество и получите возможность создавать монументы за ресурсы и станете еще мощнее, потом их апгрейды. Победив всех божеств, дальше следуют бесконечные П. Баалы, а вы сможете стать еще сильнее за счет прокачки планеты. На нее периодически нападают Высшие Существа, побеждая их добывается энергия, которую можно потратить на создание кристаллов, одев которые в конечно же станете еще мощнее. Еще есть Divinty Generator, чтобы создавать эти самые Divinty и больше и быстрее производить ресурсов. Так же по мере игры открываются питомцы, которых нужно кормить, отправлять на сражение со своими клонами или в многочисленные компании. Ну и так же после овладевания всеми тренировками становится доступна Might (мощь), где можно продолжить развивать свои характеристики, а после победы над последним из божеств открывается мини игра, где нужно попадать в маленькие полоски на линии, повышая урон крита и его шанс против П. Баалов. За определенные успехи даются god power, которые делают вас еще круче. Максимальное количество клонов повышается после их убийств на монстрах и создания новых до капа в 100к. Не забывайте ежедневно собирать билетики, из них иногда падают приятные штуки. Когда достигните более менее всего возможного, можно переходить на всевозможные челенджи, суть которых сводится к достижению определенных задач с разными ограничениями.[/b]
[spoiler]Как итог могу подвести что это ПРОСТО EБAНЫЙ ЛЮТЫЙ НAXYЙ БЕЗГРАНИЧНЫЙ ПИЗДЕЦ И Я НЕ СОВЕТУЮ НИКОМУ НЕ ЗАХОДИТЬ В ЭТОТ БЛЯДСКИЙ TIMEWASTER ЕСЛИ ВЫ НЕ СОВСЕМ НАГЛУХО ОТБИТЫЙ EБЛАН С МИЛЛИАРДОМ СВОБОДНОГО ВРЕМЕНИ[/spoiler] [spoiler]по русски - школьник.[/spoiler]
Вот вроде бы и все. Спасибо за внимание. Успехов в жизни.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063302851', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13642, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5096, 'last_played': 1492898383}
review: As a recovering idle game addict, [b]Idling to Rule the Gods[/b] was definitely one of the more interesting and appealing games I watched numbers go up on. Artstyle wise, it's fairly simple. Gameplay wise, however, ItRtG is no pushover. With the plentiful numbers going up, eventually the game, like many other idle/incremental games, comes to a standstill. Normally this would be where many give up, but there is a Rebirth option in this game which rivals many others. Basing off how far you've come in your current rebirth (how many bosses, or Gods, you've killed, training acquired, etc. etc.) it would impact your playstyle in the next run immensely. I haven't gotten far in the game, because as I had previously mentioned, I am a recovering addict. But if you've gotten into the funk that is idle/incremental gaming, this is definitely one to look out for.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996890045', 'num_games_owned': 3060, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 1658403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13908, 'playtime_at_review': 65926, 'last_played': 1712455149}
review:
Idling to Rule the Gods is mainly a text-based game (although it does have some pictures in it).
It works on a similar basis to clicker games, whereby you have to level up as far as you can, then ascend (or, in this case, "rebirth") and start all over again, with a slightly stronger basis each time.

You create items which can be used in your fight against the gods. More items are unlocked as you go.
Then you can build monuments and use pets as extra aids in your fight.
Training in various elements is also key to the process.

The game is mainly self-explanatory, although there are some tasks that won't necessarily be obvious at first.

When you first start, it seems to take a long time to level up through the various gods you have to fight.
Don't expect to get all of the achievements quickly - it's going to be a long slog (if you look at the global achievement stats you can see just how few players get the higher achievements).
To get all of the Steam achievements, you have to be in it for the long haul.

Nonetheless, it's a somewhat interesting game.
Be warned that Idling to Rule the Gods is not everyone's cup of tea.
However, if you have the patience for a long-term text-based game, then by all means give it a go.

P.S. There are daily bonuses you can get, so don't forget to check for them.
And it includes some small side-games as well.

review:
Ignore my hours, I started on kongregate years ago.

This game, while appearing as a menu simulator, is a mathematical nightmare.  You will spend your days theorycrafting min/max and timings. You'll work out the best ways to progress, which direction to go, and always have so much ahead of you.

I've played tons of idle/incremental games, and this one has it all, including pets & wings!

author: {'steamid': '76561198169434263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2045681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512416, 'last_played': 1650741260}
review: I have a few hours "idling" this game. You can be as active or as non-active as you would like and still feel like you’re doing something. There are many aspects to this game. Pets and training, some players speed run and others rarely do anything. There are real money items you can buy, but most are quality of life items. There is an in game chat where most of the time others are helpful but keep in mind some of them min max to the extreme so some of the help they give you, will mean nothing. Play the game as you see fit, the dev or creator or whatever he calls himself does patch the game and add content often, sometimes too often as you can get overwhelmed with what to do next. Everything in this game takes time. Just remember you are playing for yourself, some people forgot this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052980035', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1661565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512064, 'last_played': 1666434644}
review:
ITRTG was my introduction to the Idle gaming Realm about two-two and a half years ago. If you can't tell by my play time - I've enjoyed the hell out of it. Typically I'll play a game for a couple weeks (maybe a month or two if I feel it's a decent game), before I put it down and move on. I had ONE period where I put the game down for two months because I didn't understand a mechanic of the game.

The UI, while not the most intuitive at first makes more sense if you give it a bit of time to get used to. There's also a community that will help you, both in IRC (in-game or via your own IRC client) and Discord.

Pros
-[b]Active Developer[/b] - Ryu is very active in the community, Kong, Steam, and Discord. The game is still getting attention even  while he's got other projects ongoing.
-Plenty of content to go through (several years)
-Number crunchers will have a good time min/maxing
-You don't need to stare at the game to make progress, though you can if you so choose.

Cons
-Daunting to get into initially
-Some things are lost in translation. Ryu speaks english, but it's not his first language, so the phrasing on some tooltips lead to some misunderstandings (counter Pro to this - the community can help you with this if you're willing to ask!).
-Some tasks in game seem daunting (There's a challenge set that may take approximately a year to complete, give or take a few months).

Don't be afraid to give it a try, make mistakes, and ask questions. We're all here to have fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070916659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1479539756}
review: I mean I gotta give it to this game, it tried. Honestly I almost gave it a thumbs down, but what I managed to read of the story saves it. As a game it's honestly just another clicker. Better than some I suppose, but what is that. The story though actually kept me wanting to play more. Which is what I think is the most important question to ask to decide whether a game is good or bad. Does it make you want to play more. And yeah, I was enjoying myself and I wanted to keep playing ItRtG. Until a point where the prospect of rebirthing and having to spend a long amount of time just getting back to where I was (faster of course because of the rebirth bonus, but still...) just didn't seem like fun anymore. Your mileage may vary. I mean at least it's free and unlike other games it stays free, so sure. For me it just takes too long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059343217', 'num_games_owned': 2569, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1608000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317725, 'last_played': 1640396322}
review:
Best idle game ever. Much deep content.
Your rewards aren't just as linear as in most idle games, where you mostly try to get a currency through resetting, but you also have challenges to complete for unique rewards. And there are still more challenges coming out, adding to the content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154661444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3143029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649215, 'last_played': 1710498102}
review:
Do not be fooled by the simple appearance.  ITRTG is the deepest idle game you will ever find.

Look, I have over 37,000 hours for a reason.  This game was made by 1 person who is an active member on the Discord, always taking suggestions and constructive criticism on mechanics.  ITRTG feels like a game that is built by a community of die hard fans.  Because it IS.

You'll never be on your own here.  We have a very active Discord and a website made by the dev himself.  If there's anything you're struggling with, or don't understand, or don't know which path to follow we're always here to offer advice.

Over 37,000 speak for itself already.  If you like idle clickers, then give Idling to Rule the Gods a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105062512', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 150442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53262, 'last_played': 1689900029}
review:
I have been frustrated by some "free to play" games which, after a "honeymoon" couple of hours of enjoyable play, start to shamelessly demand $$$ from the player for the game to continue to make any sense.

Well, having played ItRtG for 800+ hours (or maybe it's been closer to quinquagintaquadringentillion hours or so... :-) ) I am happy to report that this is not one of those frustrating games. It's actually a lot (like quinquagintaquadringentillion) of fun. The game has a lot of depth and can be played in many different ways. Of course, it has in-game purchase options, but you can have a ton of fun playing without spending a dime. In fact, it is precisely because of this that I am inclined to actually spend some $$ on this one and support the author.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992550343', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 134722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78111, 'last_played': 1700811835}

author: {'steamid': '76561197986116589', 'num_games_owned': 1057, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1917576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287519, 'last_played': 1670505934}
review:
IMO, this is the best Idle game I have ever played.

And I have played a lot of them, even those not on steam. For reference, all the steam suggestions for "More like this" are already in my library. (And all have at least a few hours if not a few dozzen or hundred on them)

Having said that, this game is not for everyone. If you are someone who does not like math (And I have been told that this is a majority) then the game will not seem like much to you. If you love math however, then this is the game for you!

The game starts off complex and unlocks more complexity as you progress. While the sublimeness of the unlocks may not reach Universal Paperclips level of sublime, it does have it's own charm. Achieveing objectives opens up other objectives and hidden unlocks for very varied gameplay despite the same basic math.

You decisions in how to allocate resources and time can have very dramatic effects on the outcome.

The in-game story is basically an "Isekai" theme which fits very well.

Updates happen regularly adding ever more content and more beautiful math to figure out. This includes quality of life updates that streamline or take a lot of clicking out of the game. 



TLDR: The math is beautiful!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068183434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 139212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70270, 'last_played': 1656710411}
review:
I feel good when playing this, because I'll always know that someone out there played this game even more than I do.

Also I'm idling my life away, and I don't care.


Oh yeah, it's one of the best games to just idle away your everything. The beginning is a bit complicated at first, but after some rebirths it's understandable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198248824968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1933540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83240, 'last_played': 1676161181}
review:
pros:
* deep gameplay, steep learning curve
* a lot of updates (events every few months plus a ton of QOL updates and bug fixes - there is a list you can vote on & suggest to and most stuff gets implemented a few months later)
* no need to buy stuff with real money (BUT you can support the DEV by buying pet tokens, if you want to - buying god power is kinda useless)
* great community (access via chat)
* secret game play & pets / a lot of unlocks to make the game even more complex

cons:
* graphics are even less than 'meh' and you can 
change the UI so it at least looks ok/nice.
* Don't play it if you don't like idle games or don't like to plan ahead 
or hate maths/calculating/planning/idle games.


THE best idle game out there ever imho.
The game is not easy so if you don't try to learn it, then 
better leave it.
BUT there are more and more guides and the community is extremely helpful (IF you can wait for a few minutes or a few hours for an answer in the ingame chat - time zones, work, sleep...
or else just try out the discord server.)


Edit: Afaik, autoclickers and AIs aren't forbidden IF you don't submit your highscores.
I think it's fine, if you do it to study AI development or if you are handicapped in some way.
Using cheats usually ruins any game for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039187662', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3367, 'last_played': 1521331214}
review:
Symulator okienek i przycisków. ITRTG trudno nawet nazwać grą, jest obrazek boga czy tez bogini, który swoja droga wyglada jak zrobiony w paincie, z boku jest generator liczb ze niby postać staje sie silniejsza. I w zasadzie tyle zostawiasz gre włączoną na kilka tysięcy godzin i jak kalkulator wygeneruje odpowiednia liczbe masz walke z "bogiem" tzn. czerwonym paskiem.

Gra ma udziwnienia w stylu monumentów, planet, challengy i petów co daje możliwość poklikania sobie od czasu do czasu no i wydłużaja rozgrywke o te kilka setek czy tez tysięcy godzin. W praktyce to klikniesz czekasz czekasz czekasz....
Na początku to nawet jakoś idzie później już nie bardzo.

Black Hole time to build 2716 days, 12:04:42 hours (1000 clones) zrzut z gry pewnie jak bym miał lepszy kalkulator to zbudowałbym black holea w 10 sekund. Niby gra Idle, ale gralem w kilka tytułów gdzie można było pograć i poklikać w ciagu jednego dnia mieć jakiś progress tutaj nic z tego. 

No i koszmarne UI

author: {'steamid': '76561198028118165', 'num_games_owned': 940, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 6669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6164, 'last_played': 1524112230}
review:
The apex predator of the useless-numbers-go-up jungle. The amount of time I've wasted babysitting its little window is embarrassing. 110 hours spent staying up late to push numbers around its spreadsheet for optimal leveling efficiency. I will say that while playing Mass Effect: Andromeda, I would leap at every opportunity to alt-tab out to nudge the numbers. ITRTG is definitely the more fun game, but what is that saying? They're both deeply stupid wastes of time, one just has a steadier hand on the dopamine drip.

Lock up your keyboard and mouse.
Send that computer to its grandparents'.
If you value your time and sanity: whatever you do, don't play this game.

2/2. God help me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070869597', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 13089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12859, 'last_played': 1507408021}
review: This is a unique idle game, and for real, one of the only game that deserves the name "idle game". It is quite confusing when you first start because there are lots of tabs and you are unable to use many but that's not what happens in idle games. You can use a guide or just do it my way; nevermind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053598024', 'num_games_owned': 3536, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1065197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4179, 'playtime_at_review': 8338, 'last_played': 1712452750}
review:
At first I was very skeptical about this - what can a free *idle* game be, other than boring and loaded with microtransactions, after all? The interface is not very polished either.
BUT after having played for a while, things totally make sense. Real money is not required to advance, albeit patience is required, which is fine for an idle game.
The game plays like a very abstract economy build up game. Think of civilisation without a map. You optimize different parameters that in turn increase your rate of progress. The whole challenge is to distribute current resources optimally across a variety of settings in order to progress at maximal speed.
Check out the FAQ and the forums for information on how to play, you need it. But the game is not too hard to learn.
It is a game that I play in work breaks - as an idle game it is not meant for continuos play. For that purpose the concept makes the game fun and a good interruption of work. You constantly get a little feeling of progress.
Thumbs up, check it out!

EDIT: Years later, there are still new features being added, making this an even greater game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112810429', 'num_games_owned': 2594, 'num_reviews': 578, 'playtime_forever': 22585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20107, 'last_played': 1658285347}
review:
Absolutely minimalistic graphically, it's the game just about idly raising stats. It's not a clicker! You don't need to do much clicking by yourself... but you need to make a lot of choices of what's to spend your time and points for, to grow up in power faster, go further, and achieve even more.

Once again - it's really a game-not-for-everyone. If you can tolerate idle games - that's one of the best on the market. If you do not have the patience of doing literally anything but to watching your Tamagotchi raising in power and growing its own Tamagotchi(s)... well, just pass by!

As my personal mark, I'd go with 6/10. It's fun, but could really use some more updated visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073864538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1042269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3524, 'playtime_at_review': 182837, 'last_played': 1712440456}
review:
After putting multiple hours and finishing the ultimate Arty Challenge I must say that this is the best Idle game i ever played. Most Idle/clicker  games have an endgame which is no more enjoyable to play. Clicker Heroes, Soda Dungeon and Adventure capitalist are just 2 examples. This Idle game doesn't get boring in Endgame and the stat\resources and challenge system is makes this Idle game more complex when it comes to min maxing. To keep it short here is ashort list of pros and cons

pros
+no paywall to be able to play the game as it is meant to
+In game purchases which just speed the progress a little bit, but don't feel mandatory
+Lucky Draw each day to get "premium" bonus. The odds are OK 
+no fancy graphics( my preference, also listed at cons for people who do not like games with simple graphics)
+good endgame
+good midgame
+right to brag after finishing ultimate Arty Challenge
+Offline calculation and progress
+many different resources/statistics which influence your progress
+Challenges which give you bonus
+Not a so simple prestige/rebirth system as used in Other idle games

cons
-menu is hard to get used to
- pretty hard to get into
-you will eventually do the Ultimate Arty Challenge^^
-no fancy graphics

Conclusion : best idle game currently available 9.5/10. Please give the game a chance, even if the early game seems kinda boring :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198033756123', 'num_games_owned': 195, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 885997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1615355710}
review:
Currently 130 hours into the game AND downloaded it on another account for my phone.  I enjoy the idle genre, as it gives a sense of satisfaction that is hard to get in most other games.  This one however, is much different from other idle games you have played. I'd recommend giving it a shot, but would also recommend that you watch a youube video to preface it (in place of a tutorial).  Or ask a friend that has played it.  Starting can be VERY rough (I had people telling me how to start it, so my start wasn't too bad thankfully) 

Pros:
-Very Cool story.  Seriously, the story is addicting and has me coming back to re-read it while I'm idling.
-A lot to do.  You can play this like an idle game, or (after first few rebirths) can actually spend hours of active play.
-The male hero looks kinda like Goku.  Seriously.
-The descriptions and abilities are hilarious.

Cons:
-Annoying menus.  Takes a few hours to learn the menus, and annoying that you have to swap between them so often.
-Wording of some things is confusing.  
-Dark Gray everywhere.  No color.  You can change some of the colors, but lack fine control over it.  You cannot make it look good, no matter how long you try (trust me). I don't know if this is how the end product will be, but it should probably get a cool shell to be played in. (although it is reminiscent of the old text/browser based games I grew up with).  Not a huge con for me, but is a big turn off for most people i know.  

TL:DR: I would recommend if you like these types of games, I would rate it 7.5/10 with potential to be a 9.5/10 easily.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212647955', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 555591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 16548, 'playtime_at_review': 53230, 'last_played': 1712455365}
review:
If you want a game for managing resources and mostly-passive play in maximum of five-minute bursts, this is probably for you. If you want something that's played mostly actively, maybe not. {there are exception strategies, but not *that* many.} It's also rather complex, though less-so than some of the reviews make it sound. 

The game has a lot of different elements to micromanage, but none of them are, on their own, immensely complex. This game has only two clicker analogues/minigames as far as I've gotten- the special fights and the baal slayer. I think ultimate beings V2 are going to be a third, but it's not viable for me yet. None of these is incredibly neccessary.

Anything else's gameplay is micromanaging in some manner. Progress bars will fill with you or without you, but you can optimize through micromanaging or reset to restart building with an exponentially increasing starting multiplier. This is a very reset (rebirth in-game, at least for the simplest kind. Challenges are a higher-level kind.) heavy game, by the way. Active players might "rebirth" as often as every 1-2 hours for optimal progress. 

I enjoy this game, you might not. Still, one word of advice- either read the built in FAQ guide or look for a user-made guide. This game might be less complex than people are selling it as, but it doesn't start as simple as most idle games.

And don't pay attention to my playtime, I run it in the background. I spend between 1 and 5 minutes on the game per hour on record, usually, and when it's dramatic in either direction, it's usually less, such as 0 minutes per hour. A more relevant unit is when I started- which is less than six months ago but more than 3.

PS. ignore the people who complement the story. It's not horrid, but you'd probably find reading an average web novel to be a better use of your time. Who knows, your opinion may vary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093798764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 15079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9630, 'last_played': 1701317123}

author: {'steamid': '76561198062924347', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 142772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 6286, 'playtime_at_review': 6302, 'last_played': 1712340246}
review:
Idling to Rule the Gods es un juego profundo, ameno y con gran contenido, puede engañar sus gráficos (casi nulos) pero su jugabilidad es muy buena. 

Nada malo que destacar

Calificacion 9/10

English


Idling to Rule the Gods is a deep game, ameno and with great content, can deceive its graphs (almost null) but the gameplay is very good.

Nothing bad to highlight

Rating 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198077354872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 107799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1, 'last_played': 1493297972}
review: This is absolutely the best Idle game I have yet encountered.   Seriously.   No, it isn't graphically interesting, but the balance and pacing is -perfect-, the level of complexity keeps things interesting and different, and it has a Story.   Quite a well written one too.   If you are a fan of idle games and number management, this is a great little game to check out.   It's free and fun, and definitely not pay to win(you can pay in a little for boosts to support the devs, but it never feels required).

author: {'steamid': '76561198039371133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2311579, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124102, 'last_played': 1629749525}
review:
So at bottom i will keep old review from 2016/2017ish, and this is from 2021.

So i would say that this is a okai game,  theres not really any like it.  But over the years, its clearly been in maintenance mode where things (pets, challenges, such) gets added mostly just to postpone people quitting and to increase income.

At some point he added "pgcs"  which is patreon gods challenges, which has basically been a way for the playerbase to pay him to troll the rest of the playerbase. And other challenges;  1CCC, UFCC,  UGC, UCC(remake) , MQC, LCC etc etc  have all been really bad experiences where the player experience is not considered at all. And while i been lategame for a while, other people i got to know there where not. and its a pretty awful experience.  Constantly new pets get added, since while you can get pet stones to buy them, but never enough to catch up or keep up.  

Overall i would say the game, dev and community is a thumb down.  But it is unfortunately a unique enough game where it has long term rpg progression which is neat.   But i am now free. Have quit. 


---

So i have played this game now for half a year, with pretty much always leaving it running in the background so i have close to 4000 hrs.  And i got to say i mostly like it, its a idle game with more dept than others i have played which i enjoyed. And it has a story which altho silly is pretty fun to read. 

The game is totally free and the microtransation in it while on the more expensive side is fair and convinience only. Theres nothing mandatory about it.   And after just finishing a UAC (the most time consuming challenge) i bought the refridgerator, just to support the dev with some money because why not. 

The downside is the community, the community on ingame chat (via irc) is pretty bigoted and toxic which is grating which the sole mod there seems to go along with. So that seems to be a lost cause. If your looking for a experience all by yourself ill give it a thumbs up but dreading the chat button lighting up makes it a thumbs down overall.  I wouldent recommend that to a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000076113', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 1483020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25423, 'last_played': 1685424916}
review:
When it comes to Idling games Idling to Rule the Gods stands in a class of its own. It is well made and has a good story to tie it together. The developer is very engaged and from my personal experiences with him I have to say no other developer has impressed me like he has on a personal level. As a developer the mechanics of this game are solid and have a good amount of depth. Even after a year of on again and off again I can find this game to be enjoyable and pleasently engaging. 

The only Con I can credit to Idling to rule the gods are the grammatical errors and misspelled words. In one chapter it is almost incomprehensible. However, that does not detract from the overall game as a brilliant game in the idling genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047433042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1485165083}
review:
Uhhg, i know its free and everything, but..This is just lame. the art is Really shit. yeah you can use it to kill a minute but...Why? when there are so many other games you could be playing. and you can play this exact game on Kongregate for pete sakes. Oh and 35$!!! for...ingame..what is it, divinity points? UHHHG!! why would you do such a thing to your own wallet?? thats just cruel! D: .

this would be a neat little game if the art was better, there was little animations of your clones training and fighting or whatever, Animations in general. different types of God characters, more substantial unlocks like Godly armor and weapons, instead of a red shirt and pants and a blue shirt and pants and so on ... Green shirt and pants..and a cape. better looking and more GOD worthy pets that aren't just a shitty little picture on the corner of your characters screen. i mean Mice and chinchillas? a God ain't got time for that? 

Sigh...Well, i've honestly seen and Played worse (if you can believe) but yeah i think i played enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013938936', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7224, 'last_played': 1533766287}
review:
I am into [i]idlers[/i] so I tried this game even though I did not like the title nor the way the UI looks on the screenshots.

And now here I am, still playing, longer than other idlers actually. I even find myself reading the lore of the game, which is absolutely not professionally written, but so entertaining, like a casual conversation with a friend reporting his crazy [strike]acid[/strike] trip last night about fighting puny gods who talk to asteroids to get their stone (yes, that is real).

So yes, if you are already here, give this game a try. It is definitely going to pull you in.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986914781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 60526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 431, 'playtime_at_review': 12748, 'last_played': 1712440527}
review:
This one is actually pretty good for a clicker game. I mean, there's not so much clicking involved and it does provide a good variaty of different option of playing the game. There are different modes to play with and it has sort of a mini-games in it, which help you progress more in the game. Sure, the start is always slow and boring. Just like all the other clicker games. But the more time you spend in it, the more you level up your "God"(yourself), the more fascinating it becomes.

I'd definetly recommend this game to anyone who wants to play a great clicker game.

review:
So I've never been much of a fan of idle games. Although I have played a good majority of them.
ItRtG-s is an amazing one.
You have:
Training
Fighting
Building
Prestige
Challenges

Once you think you are finished, think again, been working on this for years and still plenty more to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198185304427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 327767, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109835, 'last_played': 1551002941}
review:
This game is all wrong. The UI is bad, the art is terrible, there's no animation and it doesn't look like a proper game. It's also not simple to play, with a lot of different systems and (sometimes boring) "minigames". It isn't even hard, because if you don't play it right, you will only take more time to advance. There isn't any danger, you can't lose.

But...

You leave it there, open, behind your other windows. It doesn't need much CPU power (it even has an AFK mode to save CPU). So, why not? Maybe sometime you decide to try something. Oh.. Just 10 more minutes and you'll be 0.00001% stronger! Time to reincarnate! Ok, just 10 more minutes.

review:
Voyons ceci ... un jeu "automatique", de meme genre que des clickers avec une mécanique du jeu plus détaillé ... enfin pour des fans du genre et qui aiment maximiser, l'optimiser.

C'est moche; le jeu n'est pas très attirant. Pas de style particulier. C'est plus un démonstrateur du dynamique de jeu que d'autre chose.

Reservé pour des fans du genre, qui aiment creuser la particularité de l'optimisation, les autres risquent de s'ennuyer... en tout cas c'était mon cas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999353939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1611917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44016, 'last_played': 1671244635}
review:
Definitely the idle game that has kept me hooked the longest (and I've played quite a few). There's plenty of content to unlock, many different strategies and ways to play the game and there's always a bigger number to chase. 

If you have questions read the FAQ, then join the IRC from the game client and hang out with us.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334417371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 26183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7652, 'last_played': 1547358311}
review:
I absolutely love this game. It's a slow burn to begin with, and I haven't unlocked everything yet. But when I end up making progress, it make me feel accomplished. It's fun reading the story and imagining it for myself. I'm tempted to write a story based off of this myself. I wish there were more games like this one!

I see so many possibilities with games like this, different stories that could be built. I play this game when I have writer's block, it's really helpful!

author: {'steamid': '76561198148498837', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 71371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59789, 'last_played': 1565591846}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist das Beste Idling Spiel das ich bisher gespielt habe und nach ~1000 bin ich bei weitem noch nicht am Ende angelangt :D

Man fängt am Anfang erst mit dem einfachen Training der Monsterbekämpfung und des Kämpfen gegen Götter an doch es wird immer mehr und das Managen der eigenen Klone wird auch immer wichtiger wenn man die Balance zwischen Might, Training, Moster kämpfen, Klone für die Haustiere, Divinity Gegnerator und vielem weiterem Aufteilen muss xD

Durch das Wiedergeburten System wird auch immer wieder man an den Anfang der Aufteilung geschmissen womit man immer wieder von neuen Nachdenken muss ob man jetzt die 20K Klone zu den Monster oder zum Training steckt was beim ersten Softcap von 99999 einen dann vor eine echte herausforderung stellt doch wenn mit dem benutzen von God Power kann dieses auch wider erhöht werden.

Ein großer Punkt des SPiles ist natürlich das AFK-Spiel, ich konnte mich einige male ertappen nur das Spoiel anzuschalten um nur das AFK-Spiel zu starten :D
Dort kann ein "Afky God" gelevelt werden und ich finde das macht auch tierisch Spaß immer schon mit dem Mauszeiger auf dem "Power +1k" butten zu halten um dann zu level wenn man genug Exp hat :D

Ich kann jedem Fan von Idling-spielen dieses Spiel nur ans Herz legen da es wirkl. mehrere Tausend Stunden an Idlingspaß und Zeitvertreib bietet :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198083336629', 'num_games_owned': 1129, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 840714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388440, 'last_played': 1703040448}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979010577', 'num_games_owned': 3579, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2211214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84958, 'last_played': 1661791300}
review:
Where so many idlers focus on the fancy art and click effects that you get bored of after the first twenty minutes, ITRTG is all about questing for the next increment.  The game is ugly; there's no denying that, but the underlying mechanics are polished and there's actually a dozen different things to split your non-time on.  For the first couple of weeks of game play, I'd think I was done unlocking new goals only to discover yet another additional mechanic to level up.  Then I looked closer at the Challenges and realized there's a load of reasons to reset from zero for even MORE permanent bonuses.  I've been poking at this thing for most of a year and I haven't even built a galaxy yet.

If you're looking for a time-eating incremental idler, this is a good one.  There are tons of different goals to work towards at your own pace and an honestly interesting back story told through an optional side menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130350087', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2177, 'last_played': 1481812345}

review:
The thinking man's idling game. Has quite a bit more depth than other idling games in terms of various things you can do to increase your stats. The challanges are a nice addition to keep the game interesting.

Edit: And after over 12000 hours in, I can say this is definitely the best idling game I've ever played. The developer is still pushing out changes about every 3 months or so. Getting a new set of challenges in when I haven't quite completed all the ones that are currently out. This keeps the game engaging throughout all this time.

review:
One of the better incremental games I've played. You seemingly never run out of things to do. The dev is active in the community and listens to feedback fairly well. 

The start can be a bit frustrating as without a tutorial and you figure stuff out but after you get past the initial grind, its opens up many possibilities. Best advise would be to start with the training tab, moving to the fight>gods tab and learn each one at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080548193', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 6140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2223, 'last_played': 1640833369}
review:
At the start, you will probably not enjoy the game that much because of it's complexibility, you will get confused at first glance and won't even have an idea of what you could possibly do but if you give this game a chance trying to understand it more deeply and do a small research about it in the internet, you will notice how this game is worth a try. This game easily differs from other idle games because of its innovative system, I started playing it yesterday because I was bored and despite all the doubts I had at the start, I can say it was pretty enjoyable. It's only a matter of time until you can learn or even master the game.

Some people judged the book by its cover while doing their bad reviews and didn't really try to play it, but like I already said, this game is very good, but it's not easy to get into. It's also important to say that this game is not pay2win, all the real money stuff you can buy are very optional and act like a gift for the ones who support the developers. Also, don't underestimate this game potential because of the simple graphics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198183840971', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 28769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18513, 'last_played': 1487038361}
review:
I almost like, most idling games.
I really like this one.  However, some of the minigames are just sort of gimmicks, not really game like.   The story the author puts in, is interesting to read as well. 

It's a little tedious earning the godpower you need to advance at the end game levels of the game, and its pretty expensive to buy.  There are ways to earn it the game, but its a tiny amount. 

Doesnt steal from its fun nature though. Its not a game you sit and play for hours, its a game for people with lives. Very numbers oriented, and as a math guy myself, (see the name?), i love it. 

I'll give it a 7.5 out of ten.

review:
Idling to Rule the Gods is an Incremental Idle game.  It worked, looks ugly, plays ok, has no sound.  The UI is clunky and ugly. There are no graphics or has primative graphics. 

Try it, if you love Incremental Idle games and Math, is a more nerdy game. 

Don't play it if you are looking for graphics and action. There are better games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070796571', 'num_games_owned': 724, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 4358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1502707201}
review:
There are those who say this game is bad because it "accused them of cheating" I can't speak for these reviews because this hasn't happened to me. There are those who say this game is bad because progression is slow, and what I can say to that is "Have you ever played an incremental game?".

This game is not a clicking simulator like many other incremental games end up being, with this game setting up an autoclicker will benefit you very little. Progression certainly FEELS slower than some other incremental games, but that's only because it doesn't have fancy graphics or sound effects; if you're actively playing this game it will feel slower because of the simplicity of the game.

Let's compare this to other incrementals on Steam:
-Clicker Heroes is a pretty solid game, but it fails to do anything special at all after prestiging a few times.
-Crusaders of the Lost Idols is an EXCELLENT game...assuming you've got the time to mess around with it nearly 24/7, otherwise progression in it is MUCH slower than this game, not to mention the content just loops with increased stats every 50-100 levels.
-Time Clickers if taken at face-value appears to be an in-depth experience, after logging a few hours however you see that it leads nowhere.
-Crush Crush is a fairly solid game but ends up slowing down to a slow, painful, MULTIPLE DAYS LONG grind after unlocking the first 7 or so girls.
-AdVenture Capitalist is certainly not for everyone, I personally hated it but love most incrementals.
-Every other incremental on Steam is a massive joke.

All I can say negative about this game thus far is that the micro-transactions are ludicrously expensive, however they offer such insignificant advantages that you'd have to spend $100 just to save a days worth of grinding. An example of these in-game purchases is a "Godly Liquid", this will increase your production by 100% effectively cutting the amount of time needed to complete certain tasks in half, the catch? It costs $1 and only lasts for 90 minutes.


Tl;dr - just download the damn game, it's like a 100mb download.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045550157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 747366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143386, 'last_played': 1654294662}
review:
10/10 Could not get passed the stat screen ever.

^ But to all seriousness this is a pretty good game. The grammar in the game isn't the best if you've read the story (Looking at Chapter 10). There are various ways to progress in the game. I spent 35 dollars on the game because it has helped me kill quite a bit of time (seriously into the stat screens). There isn't really too much of a difference between your skills when you're using them on auto (never tried fighting the gods myself). Anyway, afk for a lot of the time (work and sleep) but I'm on this game a lot (it makes sense to play this game before everyone else loads into League of Legends or even Smite (Because I'm normally the first one loaded into those games).

This game is about making progress (I know that sounds extremely stupid) but when you start off playing the game, you start off at lvl 0, 1? Well anyway... you defeat your first god like the game actually tells you to do at one of the screens if you manage to find it and you "learn" how to "rebirth" your character. If you actually read the story you actually defeat your first god when you're like 50 something (Most likely) with the help of your "shadow clones" strengthing themselves to actually strengthen you. This is assuming that your character starts off in his/her twenties. After your rebirth you start off at lvl 0, 1 again (Can't remember if it's Zero or lvl One...)? I would like to mention how the game works. There are multipliers in this game that get absurdly high (Mine keeps rising). Anyway, You start off by training abilities by sending your shadow clones to do this and you also send them to train your skills (There is a cap where putting so many clones to do something won't benefit the skill anymore). You know you have enough clones when you reach the cap which is why they have a "Cap Button". When you reach the true cap "1 Clone to train your physical/skills", you will notice that the bar appears to not even show up (because you're clone has basically mastered how to do that skill). An example of this would be "running". Before anyone asks, no this isn't all the game has to offer. Later on in the game, you can build "monuments" which can significantly boost your stats. Upgrading these "monuments" provide even higher buffs for your character. I'm currently at the point where I created my own planet and I can fight the first "Ultimate Being". These also add a stat multiplier. It's fair to say that if you play the game a lot, you should rebirth at least once a day. I play quite a bit and it'll probably take me two days to progress where I was before.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Edited October 21st, 2016
There are still challenges that I need to do even though I fought the "last boss" on my planet (with a technique I found myself [never was on the forums or anything]). I can still go and try to beat that boss again because the game literally never ends. They've added an extra multiplier to the game where you have an "afk god", which rebirths when you rebirth, but the point of him/her is to kill these shadow clones that they make. For everyone 1k clones your afk god kills, adds 1 to your statistics multiplier. So far, this is the fastest way to level your statistics multiplier. I'm also currently creating a universe for the 2nd time  (Ultimate Universe Challenge or UUC) so I can level my planet by 1 level. I still have no idea what "might is in the game" or the "might tab". I wonder how I don't know these things when I've spent "this many hours in it" lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994981737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 521934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41294, 'last_played': 1627638518}
review:
If you enjoy idle games, it's a great one to play; it manages to have a surprisingly large amount of depth without dumping everything on you all at once, it has multiple different forms of progress and things you can work on, that generally all contribute towards your main goal of growing more powerful, and it's both perfectly playable as a free player, with reasonable, useful microtransactions.

The fact that the dev is communicative on the Steam forums, quick to respond to feedback, and constantly updating the game only makes it better.

If you're like me, and enjoy idle games but nearly got put off because the art looks a bit janky, just give it a try, you likely won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198233452204', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 12872, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10276, 'last_played': 1472267954}
review:
So i started playing and thought to myself, "well, this is just another idle game.  I think it is probably gonna hold my attention for about 2 hours before i get bored."  I have now logged 188 hours and it keeps on frustrating me, but i cant seem to stop playing it.  Actually, I have stopped playing it a lot because i just let it do its offline progression thing but the fact that i am a god really helps.  I feel that i can check in every once in a while on the mere mortals who populate my digital reality and claim all the benefits of their hard work.  - actually, i have no idea what im trying to say with this whole bullshit narrative..... the bottom line is:

PLAY tHIS GAME!   IT IS GODDAMN ADDICTING!!!! kudos to the makers.

Pros:
- it is not an click based game which means no autoclikers
- it takes time, strategy, and patience
- it is highly complex in terms of the progression system
- graphics are clean and you can adjust the refresh rate
- high replayability
- IT'S FREE

Cons:
- it is very complex and takes some time to get used to
- progression can feel slow but once you make your first few ascensions it gets better
- very few customization options
- it can feel repetitive
- in game purchases are way too expensive and not really worth it

author: {'steamid': '76561198055884465', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4103237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 18653, 'playtime_at_review': 19929, 'last_played': 1712454881}

author: {'steamid': '76561197964311939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 146898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22420, 'last_played': 1673240488}
review:
it's ok
Edit: Serious review now.
When I first played this game, it was on Kongregate and I didn't pay much attention to the details and features the game had to offer. Hence, I stopped playing it as I felt it was incredibly boring.

However, after moving to the Steam version of this, I realised how much more this game had to offer and being an avid lover of idle games, I actually read the FAQ (wow!) and actually understood the various features of this game. Now, at around 400h, the complexity of this game comes out. 

I must warn though, it may get boring at the start though due to having to reduce the number of shadow clones you spend on training.

All in all, I feel that everyone, idle game enthusiast or casual gamer, should give this game a try and try to look past the artwork which may seem off-putting for some.

8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078556146', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 32245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12133, 'last_played': 1474246759}
review:
Kinda 300h into the game.
Stating what other reviews have also said imma keep this short.

Pros:
Complexity (wait for it)
Numerous variables that will make idle fans enjoy the game more than other idle games

Cons:
-Artstyle - I mean the artstyle was made by a freaking 8 year old... my son can actually draw this!!! I sure do hope that the devs fix this... and something like a CG or wallpaper or a few elaborate pics come eventually. give them some time
-Complexity (yes, i know. i know you read the same thing on Pros) - the Con here is the beggining... the first 2 hours were painful to me! Too much information and such little help, which leads to my next Con.
-FAQ. I'm sorry but it's bad.. you are assuming way too much from someone who picked the game 5 minutes ago and it needs to be shortened and MORE useful... the FAQ was useful to me to get some info after having like 50h or so.
-Artstyle (i know.) - I just need to enphasize this again... it's horrible.

Anyway and overall, i've played my share of idle and clicker games, probably spent more than 3000/4000h on all of them combined and i really enjoy this one! Too much stuff is never too much stuff when you see those unterquarjfkewnfjksnjks cillion numbers... numbers growing exponentially is my cup of tea.
Just hope they keep improving the game.... AND SPECIALLY THE ARTSTYLE (really painful)
